description:
This is probably a 3.5 but I am rounding up due to their PHENOMENAL wine deals during the week.  Tuesday: half price bottles, and I believe I saw weds is no corkage, so for deals like those, what's not to like. 

That being said I feel prices were all a bit high by $3-5 per dish. All things were good, but just slightly too expensive for quality and quantity of food. $12 for the two small empanadas we received was pretty steep, as was the $17 ceviche given the size. 

Overall service was nice and prompt. Would definitely return, but only on a boozy deal day (which probably says it all).
author: Adele T.

description:
Sadly.... over priced... and just, not up to par. 

Service was ok, and appetizers started us off on what seemed like a good path (albeit, again, majorly over priced). 

Entrees were just... "okay". The paella wasnt as flavorful as could be (should be). and the Quinoa dish was a mess of oil, too much garlic, and sprouts ... which was just.. random. 

I can't say we will be back soon. Which makes me sad, because Peruvian food has so much potential.
author: Kim D.

description:
Good Peruvian restaurant to try if you are in the area!

I've tried their famous lomo saltado for lunch and it was decent! The meat was flavorful and the sauce had the right sweetness into it. I loved that the food was served with rice and egg! Hope it came in larger portion since I was not feeling that full after the meal!

Unfortunately, the service was definitely not up to par. We had to ask the server FOUR times just to get our check at the end. I understand that they were busy, but were too inattentive.
author: Justyn P.

description: Had a great tappas style dinner at Fresca with a few friends and my friend's mom. We got a lot of small dishes to share including a salmon dish, lamb meatballs, Pollo chichorone, and plantain chips. All of it was SO tasty and I used the aioli that came with the fried chicken dish for all of the other dishes. It was SO GOOD!! Definitely try that.
author: Jason P.

description:
After a bike ride through Golden Gate Park, on a particularly chilly and foggy SF summer day, and decided to grab a bite to eat around 9th and Irving. Glad we stumbled upon Fresca's happy hour, as it was an incredible deal!
My date enjoyed the half-pound burger ($9) , which was topped by a delicious plantain--making it a savory and sweet treat. I enjoyed the mussels and ceviche and especially the Pisco sour.
We will definitely be back for happy hour again!
author: Carole B.

description: Came here for brunch. First thing we saw when we got there was all the amazing food on other people's plate. Everything looked delightful, so I was pretty not picky when it came to deciding what I wanted. My partner and I ordered the salmon Benedict's, and the steak-something, and it was really good for the most part, but the steak dish was a bit salty, which is probably why it comes with rice but At that time I was cutting back on carbs so I wasn't eating the rice which is probably why it was a bit salty. Also we had bottomless mimosas but definitely was only able to drink 2.5 before having to stop, cuz they were pretty hard. Overall, it was a great experience and it wasn't too expensive in comparison to the quality of the food and taste.
author: Marcus-Alex G.

description:
Came here for happy hour on a Thursday night with a party of 8. The evening was delightful at first. Host was attentive, it wasn't too crowded, ambiance was joyful for a good time. We ordered a round of sangria and a couple other drinks to start the night. Sangria was a good deal at $25 for a pitcher/carafe. 

When the whole party arrived, we began ordering a few food items and drinks. The waiter began taking our order and shortly realized our party was too big for him to memorize all of our orders. He forewarned us that he may forget the order and will try his best (why not just carry a notepad?).  Food came out at a timely manner, but not too surprisingly he brought an extra dish we didn't order. Food was solid though. 

After our festivities, we had to wait for maybe 30 minutes for the bill despite flagging them down multiple times. We eventually got the wrong bill. When we got our bill, they charged us for the extra item. We eventually just got up to pay since we were tired of paying. 

Overall, food and drink were solid and the HH deals were great. Service - not so much.
author: Michael N.

description:
My happy hour drink was packed.   Normally happy hour drinks is water down, but not this place.   The food was a bit too Americanized, but retained most of the traditional Peruvian flavors; even the ceviche was spicer than most places which is the traditional way I remember how Peruvians' prepare it.

The service was really good, even during their busiest hour, our waiter and other staff were always making sure everything was fine!
author: Tiffany Q.

description:
I've been to Fresca at the Fillmore location and never had an issue with the place. 

This one leaves me ... confused. I'm pretty sure I've been here once during happy hour, I might've been way tipsy, I never wrote a review but remember good vibes.

For our holiday lunch, our group chose Fresca. We loved the food: mouth puckering ceviche, amazing lamb meatballs in a foie gras gravy (get this!) and delicious lomo saltado. Since my boss was with us, I had to stick to a non alcoholic grapefruit spritzer :P

However, service was pretty much non-existent. Our waiter would disappear or maybe he was off talking to the chef or playing bartender, but aside from our table, there were only two other tables he was serving. Why wasn't he more visible and available?

There must've been something wrong in the kitchen too. Our food took too long to come out. It took an hour before everyone got their entrees. Also, our portions for the lomo saltado varied a lot. Someone got more meat than fries, I got more fries than meat, and the most petite girl in the group got a huge mountain of both. (I wouldn't complain if they gave me that plate instead)

I could not, with good conscience, recommend this place for lunch. Happy hour looks interesting with the $1 oyster offer, which pretty much is a winner since they seem to have a monopoly over that in this street. Otherwise, pass.
author: Janice C.

description:
I love Peruvian food, so I was super stoked to try Fresca on Irving.

Things I ordered:
Tiradito asiatico (ahi tuna, coconut, mango, cucumber, avocado, peanuts, cilantro) [$17] - This dish was very tasty and the tuna was very fresh. I was wondering where the cucumber, coconut, and cilantro were though. Perhaps they were made into the sauce? On top of each fish was a red pepper, but I love spicy food so I didn't mind. It was just weird that their menu didn't mention it. I think their menu needs a little updating, but this dish was still absolutely delicious.

Plantain chips [$5] - If I didn't get plantain chips, I probably would've left hungry. These chips were perfect with the tuna. Every piece was crispy and crunchy. I highly recommend getting it with your ceviche.

Service was great. Our waiter refilled our water every time it was low, even when we were paying for the bill and chatting. Very great customer service!

Overall, delicious place but definitely a on the expensive side. I will be back to try other options on their menu when I want to splurge on myself.
author: Julian Y.

description: I've been to Fresca a couple of times now, and there food is always fresh and incredibly tasty. I highly recommend ordering one of their ceviches- the seafood is so good! I also really enjoy their vegetarian quinoa dish. In fact, I think it might be one of my favorite dishes in SF. They're sangria is also always on point. I came this most recent time for a big group dinner (30 people) and they easily accommodated us, and the food came out quickly and accurately! I would definitely recommend for big groups/events!
author: Sonia S.

description: It really breaks my heart to post this, but I am so disappointed with my to-go order that I placed through Caviar. My ceviche was missing 1/2 the ingredients (no corn, crunchy corn or sweet potato) and the crunch bun on my sandwich was burnt. We all know crunch buns ruin the top of your mouth when cooked perfect, so eating an extra crunchy burnt one was just not happening. To top it off they didn't even include serve ware or napkins. So I pouted and ate my lack luster ceviche and picked the insides out of my sandwich, luckily I was at home so I didn't have to eat it with my fingers. So bummed! Guess, I won't be ordering to go anymore.
author: Whitney B.

description:
Lemme preface this review by saying I've never had Peruvian food before. Well, except pisco. I love pisco.

My roomie and I went here one bright Sunday morning to scope out some brunch, as one does on Sunday in San Francisco. As delicious as the $15 bottomless mimosas sounded, I was still scarred by a particularly boozy birthday karaoke event the previous Friday, so that'll have to wait for next time. Knowing nothing about it other than the menu description, I ordered the ceviche and a bottomful mimosa.

After an unremarkable wait, the food came out. As a first time experience, I loved the ceviche. The sauce was delicious, the fish was firm and flavorful, and the veggies complimented the ensemble well. There were some sort of nuts on the side, though, that I really wasn't into. The crunchiness didn't gel with the texture of the rest of the dish, but I've heard they're common with ceviche, so I guess it is what it is.

It was a little expensive though, it ended up being about $25 after tax and tip for each of us. It was good, but I'm not sure it was *that* good. Ah well, I'll probably be back soon for the bottomless mimosas.
author: Shawn W.

description:
I've walked past this place pretty much every day on my way to school for the past three years but I've never been tempted because a quick glance at the menu screamed "OVERPRICED". I finally took the opportunity to stop by and I learned that sometimes you really can judge a book by its cover.

Rating Breakdown:

1/2 Stars for Taste --
Everything was good, nothing was great. We ordered the paella, mussels, and calamari to share family style. My favorite thing of the night was the sauce that the mussels came in. I ended up dipping everything in it, and I'm not ashamed to admit, maybe even just straight up drinking it. Honestly, the paella and calamari were nothing to write home about, I think they use the same seafood mix (salmon, calamari, scallops) in both and just add mussels/shrimp to the paella. My one major gripe was the mussels themselves. There were a few hidden in the bunch that tasted like the bathroom smells, making me seriously question their freshness. (I eat a lot of seafood, so anyone tryna tell me that that is how mussels are supposed to taste can shove it.) I was on a date, so instead of spitting them out, I said a prayer and decided to take a chance with my iron stomach of an immigrant. A major bummer because the sauce was so good, I would come back for it without the mussels and just ask for baskets of bread.

0/1 Stars for Value --
Crazy overpriced for what it is. The paella was chock full of seafood (salmon, mussels, shrimp, calamari, scallops), but came in a small portion, definitely not worth $30. Splitting one dish and two small plates with no alcohol came out to about $40 per person including tax and tip. I would pay that for a quality seafood meal, but Fresca did not deliver. 

0.5/1 Stars for Customer Service --
I think there was one waiter and one busboy for the entire restaurant so they were understandably very busy. The wait for food was longer than average and it was hard to find somebody to flag down. 

I'm going to give a pity half a bonus star because I would come back and give the happy hour a chance. I really wanted to like this place and I wanted to come back and try the ceviche, but my experience with the mussels really has me leaning toward taking my money somewhere else. 

TL;DR -- Overpriced for the quality and portions. Order the mussels for the sauce, but the mussels themselves are like the Russian Roulette of gastroenteritis.
author: Abby W.

description: Their bottomless is only $14 extra on top of your entree! They have a strict 2 hr limit and I wish they came around more often to refill our glasses, but the chicken hash was great! We also had the picarones which came out hot and delicious.
author: Kristine C.

description: I am surprised this place has less stars as for me it's one of my favorite Peruvian restaurants in town. You definitely won't order ceviche here(save that for Limon) but some of their main enteres are amazing like Lomo Saltado, Aji de Gallina or Adobo de chancho. They also have a happy hour for drinks which gets you $7 pisco sours. Also if you want to try something new go for viuda negra(vodka + black corn juice).
author: Yéva M.

description:
Just came back from Peru and I must say I was very impressed with the quality and authenticity of Fresca! 

Of course we had to start with a couple pisco sours - one traditional and one maracuyá (passionfruit). It's pretty standard to find both options at restaurants in Peru, so it was nice to see them both on the menu here too. And they were both very good; I'd say an 8 out of 10!

To eat we shared the ceviche chifa (tuna, avocado, plantain chips) and the anticuchos con pollo (chicken skewers).The ceviche could easily rival some of those in Peru - very fresh tuna and the most delicious, savory ponzu sauce at the bottom. In fact, it was so good we had to dip the crispy yuca and chicken skewers in there too. 

Service and ambiance was fine. I can't tell if they're trying to be more of an intimate date-spot or just a casual, neighborhood spot; I saw an even mix of couples/dates and friend groups. *shrug*

In any case, if delicious Peruvian food is what you're after, Fresca won't let you down!
author: Jeannette N.

description: What can I say about Fresca other than I LOVE THIS PLACE! I love to come for bottomless Mimosas and Brunch and you get 2 hours to drink so let me tell you that a lot of beverage can be consumed within that time, especially since they fill you back up when they see your glass has some missing! The shredded pork eggs benedict is the freakin bomb. It is cooked to perfection and there are so many flavors jam packed into it that I can't help but smile with each bite. This isn't my favorite thing here though. My absolute favorite are the sweet potato pancakes. These things are AMAZING! They are topped with sweet plantains and a whipped cream topping. They are the right amount of sweetness and if you are looking to transcend into a higher sense of being then I suggest you eat these. Like right now. They also have good music playing, and for me it makes me feel all warm and fuzzy inside since it feels like a piece of my culture is coming out of the speakers. Thanks for the great food, for the salsa, merengue and all good jams from the speakers and for the amazing service!
author: Yochabel U.

description: I really enjoy the atmosphere here. The service is great and willing to assist. The food has a modern take so it does not have the heavy, richness you would eat at home. Light enough without losing its flavor.
author: Billy C.

description:
Not that impressed with Fresca. Their prices were a little steep for sub-par food. I had a friend recommend the Lomo Saltado but because I don't eat beef, I had them replace it with chicken. $23 for dry and overly salted chicken?? No thank you... luckily their cocktails were decent but still very disappointed. I also ordered the lamb meatballs based on fellow Yelpers' reviews and was not disappointed - YAY! The empanada sampler was a little pricey, but I'm glad we got them. I usually write longer reviews but I really have nothing else to say... overpriced Peruvian food that didn't seem too authentic. I'm sure they can upcharge more due to its close proximity to UCSF and students so they get quite good business regardless of their quality of food.

Also, there was a really loud and obnoxious large party sitting opposite me and my date. We're young (22) but these kids looked even younger and proceeded to make my date night even more uncomfortable when they proceeded to stand outside the window after their meal and stared at all the customers in the restaurant, intoxicated. Not a good experience, probably not going back.
author: Leslie T.

description:
Very disappointing. I went in so many Peruvian restaurants in SF (La Mar, Piqueo's, Limon) and I went to try Fresca.
I got a sample of Anticuchos, the sauce was very good, but the shrimp were soooooo small, the meat was Chewy, chicken ok...the vegetarian option was the best one. 
As a main dish I got Lomo Saltado (easy and popular one), the meat was burned!!!! All the pieces was burned, I didn't eat my Lomo, I was so mad! I didn't complain because I won't come back. My partner got the Adobo de Chancho. The plate came with lots of beans and half of the meat was fat.
author: Jaque H.

description:
If your a brunch person you'll LOVE this place ! I often come here for their brunch during the weekends . They offer bottomless mimosas, which is a plus +++ . I've had multiple dishes but I'll have to say the Lomo Salgado and Ceviche Sampler are my favorite . Love Peruvian food and this place offers amazing food. 

Customer service is always on point from beginning to end. I highly recommend it and I will definitely continue to come back !!!
author: Maria D.

description:
From the outside, it looks like seating is sparse.  Inside, there's ample of tables to accommodate any size group from a couple to a good dozen friends.  The ambiance around the bar/entrance area feels a bit hectic and loud when it's packed, but the calmer seating area adjacent to it provided an amber-hued, intimate setting just right for conversation and connection.  It also boasts gender neutral bathrooms which make it convenient for any patron.

I went here with some friends for a catch up date.  We made a reservation (which I totally recommend for Friday and Saturday nights if you have a party of 8 or more).  Our waiter came over pretty quickly and took our drink order.  There certainly were a lot of Pisco cocktails, but as I wasn't in the mood for alcohol, I went for the purple corn cider (Chicha Morada).  As some of our party was still on their way, we ordered some appetizers to keep our hunger at bay while we waited.  We put in a few orders of chicharron de pollo.  Our waiter sort of disappeared after delivering our drinks and appetizers, which was okay until our last two friends arrived and they wanted to put in an order for drinks.  When we did find him, we selected our mains.  My favorite at any Peruvian restaurant is the Lomo Saltado, so I had to totally sample their version.

The mains took some time to come and getting water in the meantime was pretty impossible.  The bar area was full but the main dining area wasn't only half filled.  Our waiter seemed to disappear again and only returned with our main dishes without the water.  We reminded him again before we dove our forks into our food.  My dish was delish and fresh.  The only thing it missed where crispier fries.  They were beyond limp, but luckily the meat and the sauce along with the peppers and onions were absolutely scrumptious.  My one friend swore by the rainbow trout while another has the braised pork shoulder.

I guess the great thing about having a waiter disappear is that the dinner didn't feel rushed.  We were able to enjoy the food over laughter and funny stories.  We did eventually get our water and the check, thought that took some sleuthing.  Otherwise, it was a great night.
author: Angela K.

description:
I would give this place a 4.5 but because they were really nice ill just leave it at 5 stars. We were in the area and decieded to try something new. This was our first time trying Peruvian food. We were expecting to order to go because we had our dog with us, but our host was very understanding and let us dine in. So first impression was pretty good because they are small dog friendly. 
When we were sat down, our server was really friendly and he made recommendations on the menu. We promptly placed our order and our food was ready within 10 minutes. Literally everything we had was amazing. I admit i like some dishes more than others but it was a great first experience of Peruvian food.
Our server was very attentive. He made sure to check up on us often to make sure everything was alright. Overall the food and service was really good. Highly recommend
author: Jermaine C.

description:
Came here on a random Saturday night because the first choice was packed and had a 1:45 wait time. 

Luckily, we were seated immediately at Fresca. The menu featured some delicious items.

My date and I ordered:
* Chicharron de pollo -- delicious. The sauce was yummy and chicken was fried perfectly. You'll be surprised by the generous portion sizes too.
* Choritos -- Also generously portioned. The mussels could have been fresher, but the sauce made up for it. 
* Conchitas -- Not as generously portioned, but perfect for 2. Delicious. Only wished there were more!
* Anticouchos Sampler -- A quite large tasting platter. Perfect for 2 - 4 persons. I especially liked the chorigambas 

The service was a bit slow to start, but they were friendly. They made a mistake on one item, and replaced it quickly and w/o fuss.
author: Jacky C.

description: We had a great time Monday Afternoon for lunch at Fresca. Very good food and great service. The only downside was a semi-long wait for food but I can appreciate they want to make it right and quality.  Each time my family and I go in they are very busy. Definitely, a recommended spot if you are around the Inner Sunset.
author: Carol O.

description: Met up with our son and his sweetheart for dinner and had a great evening of shared tapas. Food was exceptional: empanadas,  Salmon ceviche, paella, quinoa and tomato salad were great. 2 out of 4 of us loved the tuna ceviche, I found the soy sauce too salty. Drinks were also very good but small bar and wait staff were friendly and the hostess was a delight to talk to.
author: Lisa S.

description:
Amazing! I've always seen this place walking by, but never went in until now.

$15 lunch special came with plenty of food. I will be back
author: Lauren N.

description:
Terrible service. They ignored us when we walked in. When we finally got their attention and got seated, we were ignored and no one came by to take our order, so we just left. Didn't even get a chance to try the food.

The restaurant wasn't busy *at all*. It was around 3pm in the afternoon.
author: Vivek K.

description: Had a great time coming here during happy hour! Refreshing sangria for $6 per glass. Yum!
author: Kyla T.

description:
There was hair in my Paella.

Look I don't mind that there was hair, I just asked for the manager to at least check up on our table to see how we were doing, but he ended up checking other tables instead and didnt acknowledge us. That was utterly disrespectful.

I wouldn't waste my time here. Food was slow, service was bad and felt understaffed. Only reason why I would give it 2 stars and not 1 was because our waitress was nice. Would try the other Frescas instead.
author: Yoo S.

description:
Second table in the place. Its been 45 minutes and haven't received our app yet. Ugh...
This is becoming very dissenting. Our bartender seems annoyed to wait on us. We've had 2 glasses of bubbles. We're leaving .
author: Amie B.

description: Way overpriced and not good. $82 for two with no drinks and I don't know how you mess up spinach and garlic but this place found a way. Worst Peruvian food I've had in the Bay. Go to Limon in South Van Ness or Sazón in Santa Rosa.
author: Mike A.

description: Best bottomless mimosa deal in town!!! Don't tell anyone. Also the best plantain chips- perfectly seasoned and they give you a generous portion. Today I had the salmon ceviche- beautiful presentation and the acid is nicely balanced with the fish. The steak there (lomo saltado) is always good and I usually get the eggs Juliana. Service is always on point - my glass was never less than half full! Great local joint and if you're here during happy hour, I definitely recommend the mussels and chorizo app- just ask for extra bread!
author: Michelle P.

description:
Friendly staff and quick service. Prices were not bad for a city restaurant. I wasn't super impressed with the food though. I got the Cevice Bowl and my wife got the Picarones. Others in our party got a couple different sandwiches. The Cevice was very strange. It was good tasting, but very nontraditional and I wasn't super enthused. It was more like Poke then Ceviche. The sandwiches were fine enough, nothing special.

The big problem came with the Picarones. They were completely undercooked. As in, raw dough in the middle. They were inedible. The restaurant did make up for it by not charging us and giving us a little of another dessert. But the fact that it happened at all was a little unbelievable. 

I'd try visiting again given the chance, but this place isn't an instant hit for us.
author: Adam L.

description:
Very overpriced for the quality of food. Will no be coming back. A pity since I will be staying just a couple of blocks away and I am a big fan of Peruvian food.

Shared a Ceviche, Tequeños, Pollo a la Brasa, side Spinach and Chicha Morada between two people. The bill came up to almost $80 ($40 per person) including tax and tip.

The Ceviche was decent but not memorable, a bit too acidic resulting in overly source flavor. Very small portion.

Tequeños again decent but nothing special.

Pollo a la Brasa. The best of all the dishes that we tried. The chicken was juicy and flavorful. Generous serving of salad and fries. But the fries were not very good. This chicken would be the only dish that I would order again.

Side spinach. Decent, nothing special

Chicha Morada. Horrible! Flavorless enough not to mind getting a glass full of ice with a tiny amount of Chicha.
author: Antonio O.

description:
What a great place!!  We love Peruvian food and this place nails it!  We had several small plates and two main dishes shared between 4 of us.  We had one of the empanadas, the lamb meatballs, the five spice chicken and one other item. For the mains, we shared the chicken stew dish and the steak with onions and French fries. EVERYTHING was delicious. Fresh flavors, beautifully presented and the service was fantastic.  They are so nice there!

Also, my husband had iced tea (we had hit the pub before ) and said it was the best iced tea he had ever had.  

We will definitely be back!  I wish they would put a location on Peninsula.
author: Debi S.

description: Incredible food. (I haven't had a bad meal in San Francisco,YET) great service. I had the braised pork with beans-and rice. Delicious. The Mrs had the ceviche , she finished it ALL. (That's saying a lot, she rarely cleans her plate off! Lol) I truly wish we had more time here to keep exploring the neighborhoods and all of the great food options!
author: Mac D.

description:
Service was horrible here. It took them forever to order. Food is mediocre here, I think the other location is better. 

We ordered:
Yuca Fries: Meh, OK, not crispy enough
Ceviche Alianza Lima: OK, not much flavor
Causa w/ Crab: This was pretty good, good amount of crab and good flavors
Hueovos En Cazuela: This is OK, there wasn't much inside, I mean only 3 shrimps LOL. I mean frozen shrimps are expensive these days I guess

The only thing that was worth it was the bottomless mimosas.
author: Natalie L.

description:
Pretty solid happy hour prices, food, and drink. It starts at 4, ends at 7 which gives you plenty of time to get to the Sunset after work. We got there at 5:30 PM on a Wednesday night, and there was no wait, but the space filled up relatively quickly. Since there isn't very much bar seating, I would recommend Fresca's HH for smaller groups.

We ordered:

Oysters // $1 each during Happy Hour! Top it off with the onions.

Fresca burger for $9 // Large ground beef patty, soft toasted bun. Comes with fries and amazing truffle sauce. 

Adobo pork slider for $3 // Cheap and delicious. Tender pulled pork, with refreshing cole slaw.

Ceviche for $9 // Wouldn't recommend. Not satisfying, messy plating.

Moscow mule and the Manhattan for $7 // Definitely didn't skimp out on the alcohol. 

A pitcher of Sangria for $25 // Good to share! 

Great upscale atmosphere with affordable prices if you're in the area.
author: Arielle I.

description: Greg was our bartender today and it got me thinking I was in a dance battle because I got served.  We were spectacularly splendidly happy with our service, it was like we knew each other for 10 years. I will be returning no question!
author: Carrie L.

description:
Walked in Saturday lunch time and they were not that busy. They sat me down right away and they even let me pick a table I wanted. That's pretty good when not busy. :)

Food and drinks were good, not the best, but good.
I had the ceviche bowl. Ingredients were fresh, but too much sauce and too sour. I would ask for light sauce the next time.
author: Allison L.

description: Great pisco sour, and perhaps the best empanadas I've ever had!  Friendly service too.
author: Ben M.

description: Empanadas are great! Service is okay at best. Took awhile to get the food with no one in the restaurant. I will agree with other reviews the waiters need to carry around a notepad. Wrong drinks and wrong dishes came out. Took forever to get some ketchup. Had the bar burger which was thick and dry. Kids loved the French fries. My Moscow mule came in a glass. Don't think I will be returning!
author: Derek L.

description: The food is so good me and my girlfriend come every year it our anniversary spot. Never had Peruvian food and this place is hella good the chorizo shrimp skewers keep me coming back the empanadas are always fire I get the sampler and the sauces for dipping damn. The drinks are fresh and food always hot and delicious
author: Gerrit s.

description:
Sweet Potato Pancakes:
The pancakes were garnished with fried bananas, raisins, fresh strawberries, lucuma whipped cream, and powdered sugar. The right amount of canela-orange spiced syrup was drizzled on top for the perfect amount of sweetness. The pancakes themselves were fluffy and moist. I would highly recommend this dish.

Salmon Gravlox Benedict:
The salmon benedict came with roasted potatoes. The potatoes were okay. One of the eggs was a little too cooked. The dish was good, but I wasn't blown away by it.

Breakfast Wrap:
This dish came with a salad. The wrap was well-balanced and textured. The peppers gave it a nice crunch. The grilled onions made it fragrant. The cheese added depth of flavor. The beans gave a smooth texture to carry the flavor. I would definitely order this dish again.

Overall, I'd have to say that my favorite dish was the Sweet Potato Pancakes.
author: Tammy D.

description:
I loved the dinner I had at their Pac Heights location a few months ago. Unfortunately, I don't share the same feelings for the brunch I had this morning. 

The Pisco Salmon Gravlox Benedict was OK. They were nice enough to make me a new egg since one of them was basically hard poached. Other egg was fine though, so I'm not sure how one yolk can be nice and runny.. and the other one solid..? 

I was looking forward to trying the sweet potato pancakes, but were out. Wish they told us before or when we ordered. We settled for the Avocado Crabwich which was good, but I don't understand why we paid $18 for it when the portion of crab was so measly. 

Sorry, Fresca. I really like your dinner, but I will not come back for brunch.
author: Laverne N.

description:
My family isn't huge on Peruvian food but we really enjoyed our experience here! The servers were really patient and friendly! We ordered the Albondigas(lamb meatballs), Salmon Con Risotto and Paella. The salmon was cooked to perfection and among the best I've ever had. The Paella was definitely the highlight though. The seafood and rice we're extremely rich and flavorful. 

The restaurant itself was a little loud for our taste due to the bar and acoustics since we were expecting a quieter fine dining experience. 

Overall a great find that I would return to!
author: Sherman C.

description: My daughter took us here!  The food was excellent!  The whole fried fish and the beef hearts were my favorite!  The sangria was fruity and refreshing!   We will be back soon !
author: Barb L.

description: I came here for brunch with a couple of friends on Saturday morning. The restaurant's got a nice vibe but they must not be popular for lunch/brunch. There were maybe 3 more tables filled besides ours. The food was decent. I loved the sweet potato donuts, but other than that I wasn't awed. Their cocktail menu is pretty great, highly recommend the Elderflower Spirtz, delicious!! The wait staffs were super nice and attentive. I'm thinking about coming back for dinner, very curious of what they would offer.
author: Angel C.

description:
Honestly I'm not a snob about service, so I just roll my eyes at the fact that this place is under 4 stars now. I come here pretty often for happy hour and both the food and drinks are delicious. $6 house wines, $7 cocktails, $3-11 bites. I especially like the basic gimlet, sweet potato fries, the fried chicken dish, and the one with salmon sashimi ceviche. House wines aren't bad. 

Never had a proper meal here but I'd love to come try brunch here. Their bottomless mimosas are $14 which is better than most places in SF. 

Bartender/waiter guy is by far the nicest and most attentive employee there.
author: Gwendelyn W.

description: This place offers a phenomenal happy hour. It has become a staple of my husband and Me. The drinks are great. The food is fantastic. The service is great. I look forward to coming here at least once a week.
author: Madeleine S.

description:
The food itself was a 3 some dishes even 4 or 5 but the service was poor and price ridiculously expensive.  Place  was mostly empty Sat at 5:30pm.  It was a heatwave so the large sliding glass window was excellent seating for air and to people watch.  Place clean and modern with colorful pictures of Peru. Order taken promptly taken - children ordered first from kids menu, one chicken nugget & one burger.  We were given caffe of water but no ice.  Ice only available when wait staff came around with water.  

Husband and I ordered 
1) Tuna Ceviche $17 with side of fried plantain chips $5 = $22.  Chips fried to perfection - very crispy but not oily and lightly salted.  Ceviche was 5 slices of raw tuna sashimi with ponzu like sauce.  It wasn't what I expected but I like sashimi and the tuna seem decently fresh.  
2) Steak Empanada $12 - two small empanada that was bland.
3) Conchintas - scallops $16.  3 small scallops on top of 3 slices of grilled plantains with 3 pieces of plantain chips, topped with aioli.  Taste wise this was my favorite dish with layers of texture and flavor.  
4) Albondigas - lamb meatballs $14.  Five small lamb meatballs slathered with cream sauce and sprinkle with peas.  I couldn't taste the foie gras in the cream and the meatballs were dry and gamey.  
Total bill was $93 before tip and we all left hungry! To top insult to the bill our adult dishes all came out and we finished all four plates before the children's meal came!  For $100 without any drinks just water, the service was terrible.  Not recommended - should is 5 $$$$$ sign with 0 star for service.
author: Mimi E.

description:
I've been here twice and both times I've left happy. Last night my friend and I sat at the bar and shared 3 small plates. The scallops were amazing as were the lamb meatballs. However, given the rich sauce toast would have been a nice touch with the meatballs. The mushroom empanadas were fairly boring, but not bad in any way. 

Sarah the bartender is awesome! Her cocktails are creative and yummy and she somehow manages to be very attentive while being very busy! 

Fresca's is a great change of pace in the Inner Sunset and I'm happy it's here. Next time I'll come for Happy Hour. :)
author: Kathleen P.

description: Holy cow what can I say! Not only do they make amazing crafty cocktails but the food is beyond delicious. I had the eggs Julianna and I feel like having a second one because it was so great!!!
author: Linda S.

description:
This past weekend my friend finally got me to try this place and very much to my surprise, I really enjoyed it. We came here during breakfast/brunch, so we didn't get much of the authentic Peruvian food, however we did try some very tasty things. I ordered the Salmon Gravlox Benedict, which was extremely delicious. The poached eggs were prepared to perfection and there was a very generous amount of salmon on top of the breakfast muffin. In addition, I really liked that the dish was not covered in hollandaise sauce, but had just the perfect amount on the eggs. My friend ordered that Huevos En Cazuela and this was quite an amazing dish as well. This dish was full of sautéed shrimp, spinach, mushrooms, egg, jack cheese, and "chupe" sauce. It came along with a piece of crunchy and flavorful bread on top, which was perfect for dipping into this flavorful dish. This dish was slightly on the spicier side, but not overly spicy. We also decided to get the tequeno appetizer (similar to little deep fried wontons), which I highly recommend!! This appetizer was so crunchy and full of the best crab/shrimp/cream cheese flavor. It came together with a sweet honey dipping sauce, which made it that much more better! 

In addition, I really enjoyed the Saturday atmosphere of this place. The weather was very nice during the day and the restaurant had their windows wide open, which gave it the feel like we were sitting outside. 
I definitely want to come back to try more of the appetizers and authentic Peruvian main courses, which seem to look amazing! 

Although the food was impressive, the service, not so much. Right as we walked in, there was nobody at the front of the restaurant who was helping guests to their tables. Instead there was a gentleman in the back who was counting money and not even looking up, until we moved closer to the center of the restaurant. I somewhat didn't like having to get the hosts attention because I feel like this should've been his responsibility and I didn't feel like it was professional to be counting money while the restaurant had many other guests seated. 

I'll definitely be willing to give this place another chance because the food was very good.
author: Julia K.

description: I regularly get the lomo saltado here for lunch.  The pricing is good, as it is considerably higher for their dinner menu.  The first couple of times I've ordered this Peruvian favorite, it was stellar to say the least. But I've definitely noticed a dip in quality of their beef the last 2 times I ordered here.  The beef did not taste fresh, and was extremely "beefy".  I don't know if the beef was old, expired, or just bad quality, but based off of those 2 unedible experiences, I've decided to stop ordering this dish here.  They have another location on Fillmore, so I may give that a try.  The Happy Hour menu looks enticing with decent deals, so may give that a try soon.
author: Phan ..

description:
I'm a big fan of Fresca, always enjoyed going to the one in lower pac heights. The quality of food in the lower pac heights location is better. I ordered a lomo saltado, it was delicious but felt like it needed more cilantro and the meat was a little tough. 

We had a party of 5 without reservations and fortunately were seated right away. The server was friendly and brought our menus, food, and check in a timely manner. They were also nice enough to split the checks among our party.

I rate this a 3.5.
author: Joy-Alonica B.

description: Walked in, restaurant was virtually empty. Three servers chillin at the front. Had to signal someone to come over to seat us. Sat down with the menus and the server just forgot about us completely. It had been nearly 20 minutes. No water, no check-ins, not a glance in our direction. Servers were folding napkins at the front. We just walked out, passing the staff, not a glance from them. Nice.
author: Liz R.

description:
3.5 STARS

Fresca's been on my radar for quite some time, but Peruvian food isn't the roommate's favorite and most of my friends wanna head to the Mission for Peruvian, so I've never had the chance to go.

Luckily for me, I was by myself last Saturday, December 19th and I was hungry! Saw Fresca on Eat24 and decided to order delivery for lunch. I placed my order around 1:15pm and it arrived a little before 2:30pm. I had requested napkins and utensils, but unfortunately none were provided.

Ceviche sampler: tasting of six ceviches ($38)
*Ceviche chifa: blue fin tuna, ponzu, onion, sesame, pickled daikon, avocado, peanuts
*Ceviche alianza lima: shrimp, scallop, seasonal fish, calamari, coconut, onion, cilantro
*Ceviche barranco: seasonal fish, aji amarillo, cilantro, onion, green papaya, basil, quinoa
*Ceviche sangriento: seasonal fish, pisco "bloody mary" leche de tigre, red onion, cilantro, avocado
*Tiradito nikkei: blue fin tuna sashimi ceviche, ponzu, scallion, chalaca salsa, truffle oil
*Tiradito pucusana: salmon sashimi ceviche, passion fruit tigers milk, cilantro, purple corn, onion, aji amarillo

I love ceviche. What better way to satisfy my ceviche craving than by ordering the sampler?! This is actually a lot of ceviche, so I understand the $38 price tag. My favorite was the tiradito nikkei. I couldn't taste the truffle much, but I enjoyed the fish and the flavors. In general, I enjoyed the tiraditos. Out of the 4 ceviches, I enjoyed the chifa the most. It had the best flavor without an overbearing acidity. The alianza lima was very mellow in flavor. I liked the assortment of seafood. The other ceviches were my least fav. Not much difference in terms of flavor. I know some ceviches were supposed to have avocado, but that seemed to be missing in my sampler. Maybe they were having an avocado shortage?

*Paella: saffron rice, chicken, chorizo, clams, mussels, shrimp, scallops and fish with green peas, pimento sofrito ($29)

The paella was chock full of seafood and the rice was very flavorful. I kept eating this even though I was getting full. Very comforting.

I really wanted to try the Pollo al abrasa: Mary's farm free range rotisserie chicken, french fries, green salad, cilantro dressing, but unfortunately, they were out, so no chicken for me! It was probably better as I couldn't finish the ceviches and paella over the course of two meals. There were still leftovers!

I've been going back and forth between giving Fresca 3 or 4 stars as I enjoyed their paella, but most of the ceviche was underwhelming. Decided they deserved 3.5 stars, rounded up to 4. I'd love to try their chicken one day. Maybe I'll use that as an excuse to visit one of the other locations.
author: Elena N.

description: We came during happy hour, and the sangria, anticucho and sweet potato fries were all good. What really blew me away was the toro steak salad. It was worth the 20 bucks.. the flavors blended amazingly and was probably the most tasty salad I have had. They were nice and switched out the blue cheese for feta, which tasted closer to goat cheese and worked great with it!
author: Lynelle A.

description: Great Peruvian food. Pollo a la brasa is good! For dessert you have to try picarones. Very good. Just needs a little more syrup. Great service as well. Parking is just hard. Pisco Sours on point!
author: Roxanna R.

description: Amazing food! You must try the ceviche sampler and the lomo saltado with fried egg. Staff is very attentive. I would eat there again!
author: Sergio P.

description: Two and a quarter hours for three appetizers is absolutely unreasonable. The service was just ridiculously slow. I don't think I got a refill of water more than once. I'm disappointed by this place and likely won't come again, even though the food was a B+
author: Josh C.

description:
The place was definitely understaffed. By the time we got our order in, we were famished. We did happy hour, but everything took a little long. Just getting water took quite some time. I did enjoy the place and the atmosphere, but the fact that they were understaffed really kind of chipped away at this rating. The bartender seemed slightly annoyed when we asked where part of our order was. We had finished our main dishes and still hadn't received the appetizer. 

I understand feeling stressed and overwhelmed, but it didn't help to make us feel like it was our fault. We were, of course, polite, but it did take some time. The place wasn't very busy. 

The redeeming qualities were mostly that the food was, indeed, delicious. If you don't go when you're hungry, maybe it would have a better rating for you. 

My suggestion would be to have even one more bartender or one extra waiter.
author: Carmen C.

description:
Great ambience, could see this place being great for a date. Unfortunately we went a little too late for brunch, so we had to order from the happy hour menu. 

We ordered ceviche puerto and tiradito pucusana first. Both were delicious and refreshing but I liked the pucusana the most. 

Next we ordered the chicharron de pollo. These were my favorite - not greasy, flavorful and moist. Lastly we ordered the pork sliders. These were tasty but nothing too special. 

Would definitely come back to try brunch.
author: Alexandra L.

description: I come here all the time but tonight I waited 45 minutes for a cocktail. The chiccaronis were burned and we haf yo send thrm back. Not pleased!
author: Jory G.

description: Went this past weekend for brunch and the food was delicious (had the chicken has and it was really good) best part was the bottomless mimosas. For $14 and 2 hour limit this was worth the rough Monday. Will definitely be back for brunch more often!
author: John N.

description:
Love everything about Fresca! Second time having dinner there. First at the West Portal location, this time Inner Sunset. Both were spot on. Being Peruvian food novices we decided to try different items each time. Everything on the menu is delicious. Servers are very attentive and friendly. Did I mention the food is fantastic? Venture out, you won't be disappointed. 

Also, the indigenous photographs on the wall really evoked a sense of origin.
author: Rowsa G.

description: Been to Fresca in the Inner Sunset a few times over the years and this was by far the worst experience I've had there. Went for Sunday brunch and the food and service was terrible. My boyfriend had the "wrap" which was cold chunks of sausage and wayyy too much sour cream. I got the steak and eggs and my eggs came out freezing cold. I politely asked the busboy to send our waiter over and he very rudely grabbed my plate without saying anything, rolled his eyes and walked away. I get it, it was a busy brunch but that doesn't mean you can treat your customers like that. We had to flag them down to refill our bottomless mimosas and the check took forever. There were 4 other tables around us also all complaining and getting the same horrible service we were. Bottom line: Food... meh, drinks....meh, service.... absolutely awful, wayyy too overpriced for the quality of what you're getting. Save your time and money and go somewhere else.
author: Amy A.

description:
Cute spot! We had a nice brunch, and it was reasonably priced. Go here if you're in the hood and want a solid restaurant, but I wouldn't go out of my way.

RESERVATIONS: Made easily about a week in advance online, 11am on a Sunday for four. They were pretty empty upon arrival and were maybe 70% full by the time I left around 1pm.

THE COST: $35 total for my cocktail and brunch entree.

See my pics for additional details!

COCKTAILS
* Julie on Pink (partida blanco tequila, combier, grapefruit liqueur, lime & grapefruit juice, rocotto bitters. served on the rocks. $10) - 3.5 stars
This was light and refreshing, a nice cocktail.

SANCWICHES
* Avocado *Crabwich* (dungeness grab sandwich, avocado, mango salsa ciolla, lettuce, tomato & rocoto aioli on toasted brioche bun, w/ fries or salad $17) - 3.5 stars
Light dish. Bun a little stale. 

EGGS & ENTREES
* Sweet Potato Pancakes (w/ fried plantains, raisin rum syrup, lucuma chantilly, berries. $12) - 4 stars
Tasty, moist!
author: Ziyan C.

description: The Peruvian food here is delicious.  Nice ambiance.  A good place for the adults to grab some tasty food (and drinks) with the whole family (kids have a kids' menu and crayons).
author: Joe L.

description:
Been a fan of the Fresca chain since 2007. When I found out they opened a location on Irving I just had to try it.

This location did not disappoint. The servers are so friendly and the alcoholic beverages are always mixed so well. My kinda spot. This restaurant is the perfect spot for an afternoon lunch or dinner & drinks with friends. I love Fresca!

Every single dish we ordered was presented with vibrancy and beauty. It's like artwork. Their food is so flavorful. There's something so wonderful about food where each spice compliments the next for an effortless flavor of completeness.

My favorites: Tiradito Nikkei, Empanadas, & Paella
author: Christina L.

description:
Ok probably eating here after a workout may not have been the best choice, but I have NO RAGRETS especially since it was a happy hour on a Saturday afternoon.

My friend and I ordered off their Happy Hour Menu. We loved their adobo sliders. The meat was so juicy and decently not too small as most sliders. The ceviche puerto was also delicious especially paired with their house plantain chips. I also enjoyed their chicharron de pollo, which were like chicken tenders. My friend did state it somewhat tasted like Purple Kow's popcorn chicken. Also their papas fritas reminded me of a thicker versios of In-n-out fries. The drinks however, were a little watered down, but hey I came here mainly to eat, so I couldn't complain too much.

I sure will be coming back here again. Hopefully to try something off their main classics menu.
author: Denzell S.

description: Best spot in SF! Legit happy hr with delish $1 oysters 3-7pm M-F. Excellent service with humble and attentive owner.  Will be back again.
author: Michael S.

description:
Came in on a Sunday night and the restaurant was not very busy.

The service was quite bad in all honesty. Server seemed more busy speaking with his friends than serving his few tables. 

Food was good, quite good in fact, but the food was quite slow to come out. Took a very long time to get most of our food. Whether it was starters and small bites taking 15-20 minutes. Or the Samplers that we got as mains taking 20+ minutes.

If you decide to go here the ceviche is excellent, as are the empanadas.
author: Roberto C.

description:
Sangria was super delicious with the pisco..strong and flavorful.

The skewers were not bad, not a huge fan of heart and kinda greasy. Kinda pricey for only 3.

The chicken is a great deal. Salad and fries plus two pieces of big chicken.

Ceviche Classico was really good and was my fav traditional. 

Plantain was great bar food.

Empanadas was great with the green sauce, spicy and delicious.

alfajores was good, sweet but good.

Tres leeches was a miss, too hard and not soft. Wished it was paired with ice cream.

Flan wasn't bad, pairing with ice cream would of been magical.

Overall, not bad, though it closes early. Service was ok, had to call on them a few times.
author: Minerva L.

description:
I experienced the worst service in all time at this restaurant; food is decent.

7 Adults and 2 Kids below 5 for Boxing Day lunch. It took 1/2 hour for 2 beers, 4 cokes, and water for the table to be served. It took 1 hour for appetizers to appear. We did not receive all the food and drink we ordered, and still had to pay the fixed service charge on the bill. No apologies, nothing comped.

There were only ~6 other tables with ~18 people in the restaurant, some before us, some after us, all facing the same issues. The table in front of us had some food appear, and the rest appeared as they were about to leave. The other table nearby received the wrong food.

Needless to say, we're never going back.
author: Liquid G.

description: Our third time here. Can't beat the happy hour prices! Good food and good service at the bar by Rodrigo. Sweet potatoes fries were a little cold, only complaint -- all other food was good (empanadas, plantain chips, burger, and chicharron pollo).
author: Daniella J.

description:
This place is probably a 3.5 stars. I've been to the Fresca on Fillmore a couple of times a long time ago, but this is my first time at the Irving location. We came for brunch on a Sunday, there was no wait. 

The crab omelette was full of crab, but not much avocado; good omelette, nevertheless. The lomo(?) dish was really tasty. 

Maybe it's just their brunch menu, but many items on there don't seem "Peruvia" to me.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Fresca is well-known for their Latin American style of cooking. Most of the platters are so delicious that it's hard to stop eating the delectable and savory dishes. My table and I ordered the empanadas, causa cangrejo, and yuca frita for appetizers. We were impressed with the presentation, quality, and taste. The empanadas were fried outside and stuffed inside with sirloin steak. The yuca fries were crisped to perfection. Then came the entrees. 

The seafood paella was well-seasoned and had plentiful clams, shrimp, and calamari. I'd say this is a must-have at Fresca. 

Unfortunately, the duck (arroz con pato) was too acidic for us. Hence, one less star. The sauce overwhelmed the dish and ruined the natural flavors of the duck and cilantro rice. 

The adobo de chancho (slow braised pork shoulder) was tender and flavorful. The roasted yams paired with the canario beans filled us up. I'd recommend this dish as well.
author: Joanne K.

description: I love the food here! I tried something new this time, and I was pleasantly surprised. I would have never thought that you could combine soy sauce, rice, and French fries. The environment is really cool too. Although it was the middle of the week, dinner time wasn't too crowded and we were able to walk right in without reservations. I would definitely recommend swinging by for a casual dinner out!
author: Samantha A.

description:
If you *do* want to experience the SF weekend brunch scene but have a larger party (i.e. over 4 people) and *no reservation*, Fresca can be a good option for meeting your goals. The wait won't be crazy (not compared to an hour and a half, which many insane people will think is reasonable for places like Zazie, Mission Beach Cafe, and Kitchen Story) but the food won't be out-of-this-world stellar, either. You know what there will be? Ample seating and bottomless mimosas. So, again, depends on what your goals are.

The last time I came here, I was with a friend and we were pre-gaming a free Kelly Clarkson concert in Golden Gate Park (I know, I know..). While my interest in the event was of a more ironic ilk it turns out the people we met up with at the park were avid friends so I peed in a bush and left..but I digress.

Mimosas.

To receive bottomless mimosas from here, you need $14 and the capacity to drink at least two, to make the price worth it (they're $8 for a single glass). You are given a time limit of 2 hours (challenge accepted).

Before moseying to see Kelly C, my friend and I drank a ton of mimosas and did so on basically an empty stomach, only splitting an order of the Peruvian donuts. Don't be like us. Eat something more substantial when consuming copious amount of orange juice and champagne.

Today I was integrated in a party of 5 and we did well. My boyfriend and I split an order of the mussels (under small plates) as well as the chicken hash (under "Brunch" on the menu). They were both okay, nothing really to write home about, but the chicken hash far superseded the mussels. The mussels were in a sauce that lacked substantial flavor and only came wth one piece of grilled bread to dip, which seemed unnecessarily scarce.

The chicken was also just okay, the size of the poached egg it came with was underwhelming and again, could've been seasoned better.

We started arriving at 11:00, were a complete party by 11:20 or so, and had no trouble being seated, probably didn't even need the reservation I had made the night before. The place had filled up substantially by the time we paid our check, closer to 1pm. 

Service was awesome and attentive, our server was very personable and he checked in on us at all the right intervals.

I behaved myself and had 2.5 mimosas.

They're my second favorite thing to have bottomless~*~
author: Megan D.

description:
My mom always said "tus ojos son mas grandes que tu bariga" which means "youe eyes are bigger than your stomach" because I order way more than I need too. Today at Fresca was nothing different.
I ordered a paella and another plate and split that 2 appetizers and desserts with a friend. I was stuffed. I forgot how filling paella was. 
Overall I was really happy with the quality of food, service and environment. I was also surprisingly impressed that they had wifi. I brought my laptop to let my friend borrow it but needed to send myself some files. I was able to quickly hop on my computer and send files.
author: Julianna I.

description:
I've gotta say, this is some of the worst service I've experienced in San Francisco. This was our second time around and second time with bad service. The restaurant was probably only 2/3 full when we sat down and our negative experience started shortly thereafter.

The waitress got our drinks and a couple of appetizers. We said we needed a few more minutes to order a couple more appetizers. 20 minutes later, she hasn't come back and our drinks are nowhere to be seen. I see our drinks sitting ready at the bar idle for 10 more minutes and not one appetizer has come out yet. We ordered two of the mussel appetizers and only one came, we had to point that out TWICE before they brought the second one. Then out of the blue, they bring out a third a charged us for it.

We order our entrees and a bottle of wine. We get our entrees in an acceptable amount of time, 10-15 minutes but no wine bottle which I would expect 2-3 minutes after I order it. When we get our entrees I point out that we have not received our wine. 10 minutes later, no wine and I grab a manager who says "right away", 10 minutes later, nothing. At this point nearly everyone is done with their entrees and I flag another manager about the wine and they finally bring it when we basically are on our last bite of our entrees. So at this point I've asked the waitress about the wine and two different managers. It took nearly 30 minutes to get the damn bottle. What I found super odd is that there were two managers and two waitresses working, seems like an odd ratio. Should definitely have one more waitress and one less manager on duty.

The food is really good. But I will likely not go back just for the really bad service.
author: Nic B.

description:
I really liked the meal I had at this place. The Peruvian places I usually go to are primarily rotisseries so this was something refreshingly different. I'll definitely be trying more Peruvian food because of this place.

We had:
Crab Causa - this was pretty good but not anything special. I would rather try something else rather than order this again the next time I go.

Aja de Gallina - I really loved the flavors in this dish. I don't think I've ever had anything quite like it. I would love to eat this again as well as try all the other dishes that are similar to it.

Chicha Morada - Peruvian purple corn cider. This was really interesting... it kind of tasted like a slightly tart grape juice.
author: Lily L.

description: So unprofessional. Ordered to go. I was informed that the chicken is not ready and it will take an hour. I agreed as I work right around the corner. Came back in hour and my food wasn't ready. When I asked to be refunded. The workers had to call the manager who is not on premises. I am currently writing this as I wait. Can't believe there are businesses with that kind of unprofessionalism that still exists in this market.
author: fady h.

description:
So Fresca and So Cleana Cleana

Waiterbro: Arrre you familiarrr with Peruvian food?

Mebro: Heeeeeyyyllnah #AnnS but here's the like half dozen things I'm ordering...

(^_^) Albondigas / Lamb Meatballs $12 (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fresca-san-francisco-6?select=B_TXgbm-XMCUQ78cTeKuiA)
Slow the eff down when you eat these - savor every second.

(^_^) Anticucho Corazon / Beef Heart Skewers $12 (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fresca-san-francisco-6?select=t4_422pKn7RBzJB0ARnT-Q)
Chargrilled outside, Heart Of Darkness #josephconrad rare inside. Dope corn cobettes & yuca fries.

(^_^) Tiradito Sampler / Sole, Trout, Tuna $20 (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fresca-san-francisco-6?select=Vt3Z4VbXUweJ6D0r6LUAHA)
Sashimi cut refinement. The next level of the Ceviche Sampler.

(-_-) Ceviche Sampler / Seamix, Tuna, Sole, Shrimp $25 (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fresca-san-francisco-6?select=q960QhU_XejNUSsOBoqrlQ)
Clean #basic intro to wrap your head around Peru flavors.

(-_-) Plantain Chips $5 (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fresca-san-francisco-6?select=WSx-DZgZ1rnHpCrcpWebXA)
As edible spoons for your Tiradito / Ceviche.

(-_-) Chicha Morada / #datyurpledoe $3 (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fresca-san-francisco-6?select=LLwntMrU6JxYDD6NJCMvDg)
Tastes like the day after Christmas.

(^_^) Music $0 (photo unavailable)
Likeabossa Nova, Space Jazz, Smooth Criminoperator.

Waiterbro told me about some food challenges he's done around the Yay Area. I so need to recruit him to my food team. #nobromo
author: Dan B.

description: This is one of those places that I love so much that I really don't want to ruin it with rave yelp reviews. I've only been for brunch but we go so often that the wait staff recognizes us when we walk in. The initial draw is the $14 bottomless mimosas, which are truly bottomless, impressive given how busy this little place will get on a weekend. Although the restaurant is always busy we have never had to wait for a table which is practically unheard of for brunch in SF. Lastly the food is AMAZING. I've tried a lot of their menu and I have never been disappointed.  Most noteworthy are the chicken chicharones appetizer, the albondigas small plate and the sweet potato pancakes (omg good).
author: K A.

description: Yum! Yes to pisco sours, their steak with chimchurri, and mussels! Their ceviches were enjoyable but not that memorable.  Super easy to grab a table on a Friday night.
author: Linda H.

description: Last time we were 6 and 5 of us were impressed by the food. Only one salad for one person was not as impressive. So it is not 5 stars. But this is our third time and we have great food all these times. Also the pisco drinks are good.
author: Mete R.

description: Just got home from this place.  It's one of those where they include "suggested" tips on the bill.  Here, they don't even give the standard, 15%, as an option.  Instead, the three suggestions start at 18% and go up.  This is bs.  When I was a kid, the standard tip was 10%.  Then the service industry successfully began this subtle campaign to raise the bar to 15%, which is where it has stood until 5-6 years ago, when, again, the industry has slowly started trying to almost subconsciously raise the bar again.  Don't get me wrong; I'm a full on union guy, SEIU supporter, hate corporations, and hate Donald Trump.  But I also don't have unlimited resources.  The tip is based on a percentage of the bill, and the price of restaurant food constantly goes up, meaning the tip itself, which is based on a percentage of the bill, goes up correspondingly.  There is no justification for the percentage itself to also go up (notably, in SF, as of maybe 5 years ago, they now get the SF Healthy, a valuable new perk). My salary doesn't go up like that, so eating out in restaurants either becomes cost prohibitive for me, or else I have to feel like a cheap bastard when I leave the waiter maybe 18% (which is around where I tipped when the minimum was 15%), which they are trying to make on the low end of the scale.  And to add insult to injury, Fresca calculated the various percentages not just on the food and drink, but on the tax and the SF Healthy charge as well!  If you're going to lay out suggested tips, do it on food and drink alone.  THAT is the standard.  Eff this place.
author: Chuck P.

description: One of our favorite places to eat!  Ceviches have the best flavors, appetizers are great, and the entrees are consistently awesome.  The staff is also super friendly and attentive.
author: Viv S.

description: Phenomenal Peruvian cuisine from one of the Bay Area's most creative chefs. We love Fresca!!
author: Rebeca M.

description: My experience at Fresca set the bar for brunch in SF. Affordable, bottomless mimosas, exceptional meal. Our group started with the ahi tuna ceviche, unbelievable. For entrees we went with the lomo omelet (added avocado), quinoa fried chicken sandwich, salmon eggs benedict and the crabwich. All amazingly delicious! We ended with the mouth watering donuts. Can't wait to come back!
author: Sarah M.

description: Chef Michael is amazing. The ceviche is delicious. The flan is rich and moist. The overall ambiance is young and fun. And yay for jello shots!
author: Kimberly H.

description:
I thought before coming here the menu would be similar to Limon (which I am obsessed with) but I was excited to find out I would get to try something different.

My 2 friends and I had an early dinner before we caught the opening night game for the Warriors. The space is big and well decorated. Warm ambiance. 

We skipped drinks and went straight to the food.

Salmon ceviche was amazing, the tangy sauce is perfect to drop yucca fries if you get them.

The lamb meat balls were my least favorite but they came with a cream and peas sauce which was good.

The Anticucho Pollo was a perfect dish to share, if you like chicken I would def get it. Comes with yucca fries and a dipping sauce:

Lastly we split the Pollo a la Barasa- again great dish to split: I wasn't a fan of the French fries but the salad with cilantro dressing was great. 

Overall I thought the dishes were great but does not compare to flavor packed dishes and amazing sauces  at Limon !
author: Hetal P.

description:
I've always been a fan of Fresca's but haven't been to one in awhile. Lomo Saltado still the best I've had however the Churrasco/New York steak was not as good as I remember it from the West Portal and Fillmore locations. Some new dishes I've had this time was the Anticucho Pollo/chicken skewers and the Choritos/mussels. Both were great. Flavorful and cooked just right. The rotisserie chicken was a disappointment. It wasn't inedible but it lacked flavor. It was very bland especially if you compare it to the chicken from Limon. If rotisserie chicken is what you want, go to Limon instead.

The space of this location is much better than the other Fresca's. It just feels more open. 

Service was good. We did have to flag down someone a couple times but we got everything we needed most of the time.

Street parking sucks in this area but it's not impossible.
author: Andy W.

description: I have eaten at every single Fresca in SF. I chose to post a review at this specific location because it has become my favorite and where I tend to end up most of the time! The food at Fresca is amazing, this is coming from someone who is 100% Peruvian and has high expectations. They have great lunch and brunch options as well. Their different ceviches are all super tasty, if you want variety get their ceviche sampler! Their lomo saltado is literally the best lomo in the Bay Area!! I always have and always will recommend Fresca as one of the best Peruvian restaurants in the Bay Area!
author: Gia T.

description:
I dined in for their brunch on a Sunday and I was delighted to find out they offer bottomless mimosas -- however I just wanted one and got only one...but the waiter charged me for the bottomless price, which was upsetting.  

Besides that, I loved the decor, the food was great!  I had the salmon benedict and it was really good.  The coffee was okay, and they offer a good sized mimosa.  The waiting staff was very polite and professional. 

Will definitely visit again -- only this time I'll order bottomless mimosas and drink more than one!
author: Michelle S.

description:
I've had Fresca bookmarked for a while now and finally had an opportunity to give them a try for Sunday dinner. Mind you, they have multiple places throughout the city and chain restaurants don't always have the best reputation. However, this location appears to be new and is amongst the plethora of restaurants on Irving Street.  We chose this primarily because the ambiance looked nice from the outside. 

Our waiter was kind enough to tell us his favorites for every section of their menu even though we ended up going zero of his selections. I did appreciate the effort so one star for that. It's a Peruvian place and therefore ceviche was a requirement. There's multiple choices but we ended up with the ceviche puerto which had a nice mixture of seafood in there. I still have to figure out how they get such darn huge kernels. Also had was the skewer sampler. I liked all the options except for the fish skewer. It wasn't bad but fish just doesn't belong on a skewer to me. Beef heart skewer was bomb.com though. At this point, I was stuffed but gutted it out since the roasted chicken we ordered came out. It tasted like half a roasted chicken and I'm not sure I would place it way above the full roasted chicken I purchase during Costco runs. Nonetheless, the yucca fries we were able to substitute in place of the regular ones was delicious. I highly recommend doing this for all your plates and forget the baby greens. Your body will thank you but your mirror won't. 

Two more stars for the food and I'll add another star simply because the restaurant stayed open way past their closing them to allow us to finish our meal. They may be part of a chain but the food isn't bland and even has some flavor to it.
author: Quoc N.

description:
We haven't been to Fresca for years and we were admiring the changes and surroundings area (new storefronts / restaurants) in the inner sunset.  A year can bring many changes in the business and neighborhood, and we were hoping Fresca stayed to it touches after our last dining experience.

Décor Setting - Modern/Contemporary surrounding and the lighting can bring a little intimate due to the dimness.  The glass windows facing the street brings in fresh sunlight during the day and toward early evening, as seating can be arrange to accommodate small to large parties.

Therefore, it is time to Chow Down!

Drinks -
We started with a little taste of something different and selected Bruce Cost Passion Ginger Unfiltered in a bottle.  This was mild, not too sweet, and truly unfiltered per the label.  A refreshing drink if you want to stay away from soda.

Then we got an Amigo en Oaxaca and if not mistaken, it had egg white mixed into the drink.  Thought this was interesting and it sure is pretty interesting drink.  The lemon slice gives it a hint of acidity while the alcohol really took over the taste with each slip.  

Starter - Tiradito Nikkei, Ahi tuna, ponzu, scallion, chalaca salsa, truffle oil.
This arrived with a (4) slice of Ahi tuna bath in ponzu sauce and drips of truffle oil, topped with diced scallion, small amount of chalaca salsa, and green onion.  This is tasty, but for $14 dollar on (4) slice, I think we could have passed as we were hoping there were more than (4) slices and thinly sliced.  
 
Second arrival - Chicharron De Pollo, crispy fried chicken, aji amarillo, salsa criolla, five spice mayo.
The next arrival is very similar to the Japanese Chicken Karaage.  The fired chicken is moist and not dry, while the five spice mayo gave it a little kick.  Nice fun bite but not for the price of an appetizer as it can get pricey if you have a large party.     
 
Third arrival - Causa Chiclayan, fried halibut, avocado, olives, cherry tomato, quail egg, butter lettuce.
We could have passed on this as this is a miss.  The fried halibut wasn't dry and wasn't something to remember after eating.  We were hoping the fried halibut brought in some texture crunch with each bite but it went flat.
 
Forth arrival - Lomo Saltado, sautéed steak strips, onion, tomato, cilantro, French fries, soy, white rice.
This dish is tasty.  The sliced sautéed steak strips had a perfect size for each bite, tender, and favor were all there.  We hoped the fries were more crunchy and fresh and not so soft and soggy.  We understand the sauce can seep into the fries causing this, but had experience fries similar where the fries spoke loudly - crunchy.  
 
Fifth arrival -  Bisteck A Lo Pobre, grilled certified angus new york steak, canario bean tacu tacu, fried egg, plantain, chimichurri.
Talk about a steak!  Good size and cooked to the way I've requested.  The steak was tender with nice grill marks.  The canario bean work perfectly with the rice with slice grilled onion.  As for the plantain, I wished it was more cooked so the sugar would come out more for caramelizing.  Overall, I didn't think it came out similar to a loco moco Hawaii dish, and at the end, it is a dish I enjoyed.  
 
Final thoughts:
Even though we haven't been to Fresca for the longest time, it did bring out some good food and some dishes we could have passed.  Great for large parties and friends visiting out of town, but prepare to open your pocket just a little while dining.
author: Mike T.

description:
Happy to see a Fresca pop-up in the Sunset. I came here on a Tuesday weekday night and was seated immediately. 

I had the seafood paella, swapped out the shrimp for clams. It was delicious. I should have saved half for my lunch the next day because it comes in such a large bowl! I had 75% of it that night and it tasted equally as food the following day. I wish I had more. 

We also had the yucca fries because I thought I liked them when I dined at another restaurant, but they're just thick steak fries (very carb filled) with sauce. 

The staff does their job fairly well, until they forget your drink. We didn't care. Just made sure we weren't charged for it. 

Parking - it's upper irving, all luck.
author: Jess W.

description:
After wandering around Irving and looking up menus of some restaurants that looked interesting, I decided to give brunch here a try. The menu had a plethora of choices, and it was tough to choose what to order because many entrees looked delicious. 

After debating between the sweet potato pancakes, crab omelette, crab Benedict, and salmon Benedict, we decided to share the two Benedicts. They tasted amazing, and I would definitely come back for them again. Although they were delicious, they did not stand out though, compared to other brunch restaurants. Another pull for this place is the bottomless mimosas. For $14, they pour you mimosas in wine glasses filled to the brim, and allowed you to continue refilling. Many places charge much more for bottomless mimosas, so we were content with this price. 

Fresca is a solid brunch place worth trying, especially if you want bottomless mimosas, but I wouldn't go out of my way to try it if I didn't live near it.
author: Annie C.

description:
Turn around and go over to Mi Lindo Peru if you want great amazing Peruvian flavors wonderful and attentive servicce, great $$ for the food and portions. 

Walked in for a 6:45pm reservation and nobody was at the door. I saw the waiters by the kitchen see me but nobody came over. Finally after 5 min (BTW place was pretty empty) the busser came over and seated me.

Ordered 3 ceviches - 1. Ceviche Chifa (tasted like a pretty typical poke dish at any restaurant with what tasted like to much soy sauce- BORING). 2. Ceviche Classico- best one of the three 
3.Ceviche Allianza - lacking fresh lime flavor and salt

Entrees were UNEDIBLE- Paella was super dry and had NOOOO FLAVOR WHATESOVER.Returned it an asked for the Lomo Saltado (the most traditional Peruvian dish) BUT they managed to ruin that- Salty, gummy meat, and even the fries were dry, 

I also got ADOBO DE CHANCHO which had no flavor whatsover... a little seasoning and salt would go a long way

So we told the waitress many times how bad the food was and barely touched it. She came with the bill and had said we were comped the paella...Then the manager finally came and said he comped the lomo saltado.. Too late for him to finally come by. He even admitted the paella and lomo tasted bad. BUT he should of comped us also for the adobo de chanco since we barely touched it.. 

HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE. Maybe the ktchen needs to all go to Mi Lindo Peru and learn the flavors of Peru and customer service from their management.

SF has way too many good restaurants. Counting the days this one will last in my neighborhood.

**Insult to injury.. we left and the waiter was standing there texting...
author: Miriam B.

description: Came here on New Years Eve to eat with family and they were reasonably accommodating for such a large group. This establishment is pretty on the pricey side so do not be surprised if you put a dent in your wallet. The service was relatively decent considering that some would rather not be working on New Years Eve. Ultimately a calm setting to sit down and enjoy some authentic Peruvian food. Definitely a place to check out if you are looking to try something different than what you are accustomed to and you want a little taste of Latin America. I would recommend this place for date night or a peaceful dinner with family. Be open to try items you are not familiar with in order to enhance your Peruvian experience.
author: Everett M.

description: The food is excellent at Fresca! We ordered the crab Benedict and the salmon Benedict and the eggs were perfectly poached in both dishes, the crab was succulent and flavorful, and the salmon was fresh and juicy! Fresca has the best Benedict I've had in a while, and I will definitely be coming back for more. Fresca also has an amazing deal for bottomless mimosas, just $14 for as much mimosa as you want and the glasses are large and wide, not champagne flutes like you'd normally expect for mimosas, so even just three glasses of mimosa may be enough for a good buzz. The service was ok, as it did take a while before they finally picked up our bill to charge our cards, but overall, eating at Fresca was a wonderful experience!
author: Pooja M.

description:
I'm sad to see that Pasion is no more, but happy Fresca  is here now.  They didn't remodel at all, so it still has an understated elegance.  It's definitely nice enough looking to bring your parents for a meal or a drink.

We went for lunch, and had a burger and the Lomo Saltado lunch special. Both were very good. The burger was sort of awkwardly placed on a board, but the waiter brought us a plate ( cuz yeah, he knew that it might look cool, but wasn't exactly user friendly.)
