It came with fries and aioli or a salad. We got fries cuz I'm an aioli fiend. And then they brought catsup instead of aioli, but brought aioli right away when I asked.  The burger was perfectly cooked, and I would absolutely get it again.

The hands down lunch winner though was the Lomo. Wow, sooo good! It came with rice and sautéed onions and tomatoes with an excellent sauce. I was worried it would be salty based on previous Peruvian food experience, but nope...perfect.
The portion was also huge. Definitely you need to be a large guy to finish this by yourself. Two smaller women could easily split this and be happy.

I'll be back.
author: El B.

description: Terrible service. We used to love this place but would not not come back, sorry. Management needs to have better servers. Love the bar tenders. Waited a long time for service and finally got served. The main servers ignored us. I understand, they were busy and understaffed but the servers did not seem to acknowledge us and we had to keep searching for someone to serve us. The manager was nice and apologetic at the end but after waiting so long for the food and staggered food service took a long time to get the final bill. I have deep gratitude for servers and the service industry but was really disappointed and the last time I wrote any kind of review was 5 years ago. We dine out a lot in the city and can't remember in the past 4 years receiving such bad service in San Francisco.
author: Ulash D.

description: Terrible service and OK mains.  One side arrived raw (it was supposed to be cooked) and two others never came.  Neither did the waiter.  When we expressed our concerns, we were told they were busy.  Not too busy to take our money.
author: Larry E.

description: I would suggest this location get a manager for weekend brunch.  My order was messed up not 1, but 3 separate times.  The door was frequently left open which let cold air in and the turn around time was way slow.  I will not be going back to this location as this experience took way longer that it should have and left me out of patience and hungry due to the mismatches with my orders.
author: Douglas R.

description: Best empanadas! I love everything on this menu. Fish is always fresh, never tastes a tiny bit bad. Their cocktails are just as great. Happy hour in the bar is also a great deal. Their chicken with salad and fries is some of the best in the city.
author: Pug P.

description: Not sure how dinner is here but brunch was underwhelming. We got the crab benedict, one egg was poached fine the other was basically hard boiled. Not sure how that happened... but the waitress was very nice about replacing it, although we didn't take up the offer. Also got the lomo with steak strips--way too saucy and salty. The Jaela for an appetizer was good but not worth it. The only great thing I could see for brunch here is the unlimited mimosas (1.5 hour limit).
author: Sheri N.

description: Made reservations for two for Father's Day. The restaurant had called to confirm the day before and switched us to a part of three so our little one could join us. When we arrived, we were promptly seated. Staff made sure to check on us every so often and even recommended some amazing small plates for us to try. I had the bottomless mimosa's and they made sure it never got bottomless as they kept refilling as it neared half way. Would definitely visit again. This place has happy hour on weekends which starts at 3pm. It's hard to find places with happy hour on weekends so that is a plus!
author: Melanie O.

description:
Valentine's Day 2016 review, I know I'm a little late in posting this but I was torn. There a few things that went terribly wrong with our romantic dinner that I just can't let go. 

First thing, I worked that night until 9:30 and we booked our reservation for 10pm. When my husband made the reservation they said it was totally fine and reassured him they would be open late enough for us to enjoy the meal. The reservationists failed to mention it was a prix fixe menu at that time. 

When we arrived at 10, we were seated and our waiter came  over about 10 minutes later. We ordered a bottle of wine and first course. When he came back with the wine he informed me that unfortunately they were out of the scallop appetizer. One of three choices. So I went with tuna since I love seafood even though I chose tuna for my main course. We ordered main course at that time, I got Tuna, my husband the steak. When appetizers arrived, the waiter informed me that unfortunately they are out of the Tuna. Wait, what?? Only after we've eaten the appetizer I didn't even want have you told me you don't have a fish entree. So I chose the vegetarian paella since I don't eat chicken or steak... The vegetarian paella comes out and it was disgusting I had to send it back. I mean who puts vegetarian paella on the menu anyways, it tasted like bland frozen vegetables and packaged rice. So at this point I haven't even eaten a main course. 

Time for dessert... We ordered one of each. After we order, the waiter says to us he is out of one and so we both had bread pudding. It was awful, truly terrible. I couldn't even eat it and I was so hungry at this point from only eating the appetizer. 

The waiter brings the bill and he hasn't even taken off a single thing from the bill. He charged me full price for even the entree I hadn't eaten and the disgusting dessert we hadn't touched. The $60 prix fix was a joke. He told me he tried to ask the manager but she didn't take anything off. I asked to speak to manager at which time she came over after having been at the bar the entire time. She apologized and took off a small portion, we still ended up spending over $80 on a crazy bad experience and terrible food. 

I will never go back here due to the way they ruined my first Valentin's day married to my husband. I wish the reservationist would've just told us from the beginning that it would be too late and the kitchen may be sold out, or from the minute we sat down our waiter should've been up front about everything that was not available or from the last interaction the manager would've taken upon herself to make it right.
author: Lisa H.

description:
Was happily able to get my Peruvian fix here yesterday :) so much good stuff on the menu! This Fresca is newer compared to their other locations, so its slightly easier to get a reservation here.

Ordered the Ahi Tuna Ceviche which was deliciousy limey. I got the Aji De Gallina or yellow pulled chicken stew which was amazingly filling. Boyfriend went for the bisteq steak which he seemed satisfied enough but could use more flavor. Wished we had room for desert.

Decor is really nice for the small area they had to work with, but the noise acoustics were terrible - felt like both of us were shouting to hear each other.
author: Katy Q.

description: Excellent food in a fun, festive environment. The ceviche was fabulous (get the plantain chips), as were the empanadas (we got the sampler - all were amazing). Their signature dish -- lomo saltado -- was as good as we've had. Highly recommended. We'll be back.
author: Ron L.

description: We love Fresca and we go to all their equally good locations.  They have an awesome Mac and cheese on their kids' menu that my daughters love.  My wife and I live their bottomless mimosa brunches!  The sizzling pan trout is an awesome dish and the steak salad is my favorite.  Their ceviches are fresh, tangy and great texture.  Awesome place and a great value.
author: Nabil G.

description: Fantastic brunch!!!! I was super impressed! The Orange-grapefruit juice was fresh and delicious. The coffee was strong AND the pulled pork Benedict was amazing!!! The service was great too! I'll definitely be back soon!
author: Christina S.

description: The atmosphere of this place is great. Food is amazing so it's the service. It has authentic Peruvian food. The presentation of the food is great
author: Claudia F.

description:
I used to frequent this spot all the time when it was Pasion, and was a little nervous about the change to fresca. Good news though!! The food is as great as ever and the happy hour just as satisfying. 

The change in name has resulted in a slightly different decor, and updated (fantastic) menu and general greatness. 
 
Personal favorite: anticucho de corozon (beef heart) most places are scared to offer it, but it is some of the most delicious lean red meat you will ever have. Perfectly seasoned and fantastic

Also stoked on the new mahi ceviche. Beautiful blend of sweet and slice. Keep it up!
author: Chuck M.

description:
Ending up eating here when the wait for another restaurant had too long of a wait. At 7 pm on a Sunday night (prime dinner time) the whole place started with 3 tables and maybe had half the restaurant filled when we left at 8:30 pm (New place). I have to first say that its a $$$ kind of meal, not $$ as yelp says and we got two entrees and a appetizer. 

The lamb meatballs had a nice crispy texture, the inside was not dry at all, and also without an over whelming gamey taste. The gravy sauce was decent but was slightly on the bland side. 

My Lomo Soltado was a worth it dish with steak strips, fries, rice, and onions in soy sauce. The meat was just right with a decent amount of pieces and my favorite was the tomatoes in the dish to counteract the sauce being on the slightly salty side. 

The boyfriend got pork shoulder with rice and beans and after one bite I really didn't see anything special about it other than the meat being tender.
author: Maybo H.

description:
The food here is decent, but by no means very memorable nor does it distinguish itself from the other restaurants in the area. 

We had the lamb meatballs for appetiser. The meatballs were hard and crispy on the outside which offered a nice texture contrast; however, the provided gravy sauce has very little if any taste. I wish it had a tad more salt and spices which would have made the dish much more desirable.

For entrees I got the pork shoulders with rice and beans. It was just typical pinto beans, and again lacking seasoning. The pork itself was well seasoned, but it was far too chewy and hard to tear apart. My girlfriend had the tenderloin beef strips. They were very good and definitely the highlight of the meal. The beef was very well prepared and seasoned, and the accompanying frites were pretty good.

I'm giving this place a 3 stars because I don't think it's worth the cost (at least $30 per person) for the overall quality of the food. There are plenty of other places in outer sunset to be tried.
author: Jinyan C.

description:
Disappointing in a nutshell.

We arrived around 645pm and was seated promptly by the nice hostess. Not bad for a Wed evening. We perused the menu with curiosity, wondering the difference between ceviche and tiraditos. Our waiter provided explanations and offered his recommendations. We ultimately chose ceviche sampler, beef heart skewer, paella, and the steak sirloin entree. We also took the waiter's advice on the plantain chips to accompany the ceviche. 

The ceviche sampler was probably the highlight of the event. We thought that it'd set the tone for the rest of the evening, but it fell far short of our expectations. Great variety, but small portions. 

It's about 745pm now and we searched for our waiter--where's our food?! He returned to the kitchen and brought out our skewers, claiming that it was "straight out of the kitchen". Really, did it take 45 min to grill up two baby skewers of beef heart? Really. Anyway, the sauce paired well with the meat, and overall a tasty appetizer. This dish hasn't SKEW-ed our evening yet. See what I did there?

Our entrees finally came through. The steak sirloin had an interesting flavor, but to be honest, it tasted more like an Asian stir-fry with rice and all. Nothing spectacular, meat was a bit too chewy. The paella was more like salt-ella. Every single bite was full of salt. No amount of lime could make it tolerable. Our waters couldn't be refilled frequently enough. To-go box? NO THANKS. We told the waiter that it was extremely salty. No feedback was given. Don't blame him. 

The check summed up to a whopping $120. Not worth it. Based on my keen glances around the room, our orders were misplaced somewhere out of order. Other customers that were seated at the same time, had received their orders before us. I don't think the food should've taken that long to prepare--1+ wait is long.
author: Matthew G.

description:
First time to this location and decided to go on Valentine's day for brunch. 

Got there super hungry and thirsty. 

We got a half dozen BLUEPOINT Oysters $3 an oysters. That's Waterbarsf prices for Oysters. Super fresh and delicious so did not mind the price but would not do that again at Fresca. The waiter was cool but super new and had to go back to ask which is which but came back more confused. So we just put those oysters in our mouths and that was that.

The avocado crabwich looked delicious, I did not taste it (Stupid allergies) but I trust my partners palate. 

I had the Adobo de Chancho with a fried egg on top! It was so good! If you love Peruvian food or have a hungover, forget the fish (that will make you thirsty) get this! What's not to love? Rice, beans, onions, well seasoned Pork that melts in your mouth and a freaking fried egg on top. It was much better that the Pork Tocino dish which is similar at B star.
author: Tavo P.

description: If you eat here, make sure you have your cardiologist on speed dial because of the heavy salt content in their food. We dined last night and my friend's dish was just as salty as mine. On a scale to the level of 1 to 10, 10 being sucking on a salt cube, it was a 10. Saw the recent reviews of this place, but didn't want to believe, but now I do. Horrible place. Dine here if you wanna have instant high blood pressure.
author: Matthew L.

description:
Honestly, I did not really know what to expect from this place. Other yelpers may say "But they have multiple reviews about their three other locations." This is true, but there's still risk with every added location. But this place was a pleasant surprise. We were there for a post wedding dinner, so our mood was pretty high already.

Dishes that really rocked our socks off
Arroz con Pato and some Pork Shoulder dishes, GAH-DAMN they were good! The pork shoulder was soooooo tender, so divine *italian smooch on the fingers*. And the duck dish? let's just say it was gone in a matter of minutes.  We ordered 2 other dishes, one being fish and the other I can't remember. They were good as well, but the two previously mentioned dishes were so good, they highlighted the dinner. I would've been fine had we ordered multiples of those dishes. The Thyme cocktail is not that great, but whatever, the occasion was right, so who cares?

All in all, I'd recommend this place in a heartbeat over Limón. To me, Fresca is just a notch above them.
author: Aaron C.

description:
Our server Matthew was incredibly friendly, knowledgable, and welcoming (plus he used to live in NYC which we love to meet other NYers)

Great sangria, they make it with pisco I believe.
Awesome sauces with mussels (ask for more bread! But they charge $2 for 2 pieces of garlic bread, we got regular bread for free) 
Another delicious sauce with the lamb meatballs.
Salmon ceviche with passionfruit was great, good quality and flavors, although I usually would prefer halibut or scallops for ceviche. 
The crab and avocado sandwich is really yummy but messy. We got substituted yuca frites and they were a smart replacement purely for the aioli:) 
The meat skewers were very smoky in flavor (ESP the shrimp) and were super tasty. 
The lomo (steak and eggs) was also a crowd pleaser.
I would definitely come here again and order most of the same things again. They also have bottomless mimosas for $14.... Just sayin ;)
author: G L.

description:
I had a very disappointing meal here with my mom and wife. My roasted chicken was good, but everything else was TERRIBLE. 

Some sort of fried chicken was labeled mystery meat by my mom. 

The plantain chips were oily and flavorless. 

The shrimp were overlooked and stringy. 

Regardless of the price, I wouldn't go back, but this place is also expensive relative to the rest of the restaurants in the neighborhood.
author: Mark K.

description: This is a nice place and the food tastes good.  We wanted to try the specials on the board on the side walk which, according to our waitress, are apparently only for happy hour patrons  at the bar and we were in the dining area.  The table next to us had some oysters, one of the specials. We saw the pork sliders at another table which looked great. We offered to move, but she would not let us. We adjusted but felt quite disappointed. Our party had the mussels- good, calamari - good, pork shoulder tasty but meat portion was small, chicken stew was good but bland, crab appetizer was cute and tasty, steak was very good. Our main disappointment was that the waitress was not helpful in letting us try the bar food, therefore, 3 stars.
author: Barb N.

description:
One of the most incredible restaurant that I have eaten in San Francisco, all the stuff is concerned of you! The food... Ufff impressive.. Better than Lima actually... I recommended start with the Meat balls and then go for wherever you want.. Everything is good!.. You definitely should drink a Chilcano, Pisco Sour or Sangria! 
Hope to come back in my next trip and tasted another plate !
author: Ignacio M.

description:
I've been to Pasión for brunch before and was interested to see how the owners have changed the menu and atmosphere as Fresca. I've heard the cuisine is much more traditional than what was served at Pasión. 

I ordered the Aji de Gallina and Pan con Lomito. I was excited for the latter as Lomo Saltado is my usual favorite Peruvian dish and I have never seen it in sandwich form. 

The Pan con  Lomito met my expectations. The pieces of steak was cooked perfectly at medium rare. There were slices of tomato and red onion. The french roll was also nicely toasted. When you take your first bite, juice from the steak is surely going to drip, making a very juicy bite. The french fries were the same as the ones from Pasión: crisp and delicious. 

The Aji de Gallina was less exciting. It came with olives, half a hard-boiled egg, and 3 slices of potato, along with a side of white rice. The chicken was moist, but lacked flavor. The dish was saved when the waiter brought their cilantro aji-styled sauce. This sauce was well-seasoned and made this dish very scrumptious. This sauce was actually very good with the Pan con Lomito as well.

The service was amazing. All the waiters were very nice and quick to serve. Will come again!
author: Linda P.

description:
Ceviche Sampler: honestly, there's a lot of lime. i get it... it's use to cook the fish but it was all I could taste. And the difference among the four types was pretty lost. 

Albondigas: this was yummy, if you like lamb. the gaminess taste was there but with the sauce it was really good. 

Pescado a lo macho: this was the main dish i came here for and it didn't disappoint. the fish was moist and yummy, yet the skin was crunchy and crisp. The sauce made the dish, with a little hint of a kick. I'd come back specifically for this one. 

Yuca frita: meaty and yummy, sauce was great with it. 

It's a cute little restaurant, dimly lit. Totally a place for a date night. This place was good, not great the food was hit or miss. I might just need to try more but that fish was so good!
author: Jeannie L.

description:
We entered at around 4pm on a Sunday.  We didn't see a host so we walked in and seated ourselves.  There were a few people at the bar and one couple seated at the tables, but otherwise empty. We saw the manager and a waiter at the cas register.  We waited for about 5 minutes or so and left because no one brought us menus or acknowledged our existence.   

We went instead to nopalitos on 9th. The place is packed with people and the service is speedy.
author: Katherine S.

description:
My boyfriend and I originally headed over this way for some Korean food, but our intended spot was closed.  We walked up, down and around and landed at Fresca.  If you're here with friends, co-workers and the like, the lighting might be on the too dim side for you at dinner time, but for an impromptu date night it was perfect.  Our waiter was attentive and always came back around to check on us at the right times.  Plus, our waters were always refilled without us having to ask, eternal big bonus points for that. I am usually hesitant to say "we need just a few more seconds with the menu," because sometimes that means adding another 10+ minutes onto your wait time, but this was not the case for us. But I should also mention that this was a Tuesday night, not a Friday or weekend.

We were newbies, so based on our waiter's recommendations we ordered the Ceviche Chifa, Tequenos and Paella.  The Ceviche stole the show for me, plentiful hunks of tuna that blended perfectly with the sesame, daikon and peanuts (looking back, I wish I could have kept the leftover drippings that accumulated to pour over my paella later - so good!).  The Tequenos are basically happy puffs of cream cheese, so you can't really go wrong there - and the dipping sauce is yummy.  Paella was delish, though I do recommend letting it cool off a bit so the flavors can really sink in before you dive into it.  Paella is the perfect amount for two as well, and they definitely aren't joking when they tell you that!  The ingredients in each dish seemed A+ to us - overall, a really good experience that left us stuffed and happy.
author: Emily M.

description: I have been coming to Fresca for years with my colleagues and we love it here. The drinks are great -- Sarah, the bartender is wonderful and she's very creative with her drinks. I also enjoy the rotisserie chicken lunch set and the other bar/drinking appetizers too.
author: Annie L.

description: Delicious ceviche and empanadas! Came in for lunch and everything was fresh and tasty.
author: P V.

description: Expensive and food was quite bad. Poor service and poor ambiance, even dirty silverware. Won't be going back.
author: Natalie T.

description: My favorite empanadas were from a lady selling them from a cart in a plaza in Cusco, Peru. Until I tried the ones from here. We had the empanadas sampler and could not tell you which was the best because they were all amazing. The mimosas are stronger than most places I have been with bottomless mimosas, and I don't think they let my glass get empty once the entire time we were there. The chicken hash was amazing, perfectly poached eggs and a delicious hollandaise. My only regret is that I don't have a bigger appetite because there was a lot else I wanted to try on the menu. Very friendly waitstaff.
author: Tobias G.

description: Ceviche sampler was a great way to try all of them. It was nice watching the chef prepare the food right in front of us. The yucca chips was good and made me fall back in love with yucca chips yet again. The mains were well made but nothing really stood out to me. The service was a little spotty but it could be where we were seated. It took me a couple of tries to get water. Be sure to match your meal with a cocktail!
author: Han Teng W.

description:
Had lunch and brunch here in past few weeks. The food was tasty, and the server was friendly and helpful. Nice presentation and ambiance. Recommend: lomo omelette, fish on sizzling platter, fried chicken sandwich, eggs Benedict with pulled pork. Refreshing non-alcoholic ginger pomegranate cocktail.

A little pricey for the neighborhood...maybe some lunch specials would be a draw for new customers?
author: Gale H.

description: I was very pleased with this lunch from a few weeks ago. I ordered the adobo chicken entree and it was the best lunch I've had in SF in a long time! Service was above average and yes the bathroom was sparkling clean! I'll be back for dinner sometime soon.
author: Kristin S.

description: Great service & food! I highly recommend trying the empanadas and sangria. Will definitely come back for their happy hour.
author: Alissa S.

description: I thought I would give this place another chance. Great pisco sours however the service and food is not up to par with the other Fresca's in the city. Our server did not tell us brunch was ending as we ordered bottomless mimosas which ended within 20-30 min. I asked my server for a refill as we just received our food. She informed me that brunch was over and they could not refill my glass. She spoke with the manager that told her he would have to go get more champagne but it would be hot. I told her it was not acceptable and that I was not asking for something unreasonable. Overall it was not handled appropriately by our server and I felt uncomfortable. My paella was overly saturated with tomatoes, no saffron, and not the proper grain of rice. The ceviche was flavorless. I was extremely disappointed and the experience ruined our brunch and appetite.
author: Alona R.

description: 4 of us ate late on a Sunday afternoon.  The service was just awful even though the restaurant wasn't busy.  The food was good but way overpriced, and the portions were small.  Would not recommend nor return.
author: Phyllis N.

description:
I had dinner with my friend on Saturday night at 6:30pm (made a reservation through Open Table, just in case). Place was not so crowded at that time, but got pretty packed somewhere around 7:30. 
I love the ambiance (better than West Portal location) and good service. Food was pretty good. Nice wine selection. We had white wine from Argentina & Spain. 
BEEF HEART skewers are the best I ever had! So juicy & tender. I definitely coming back just to have this dish :) 
Also, plantain chips were fried just right, not greasy at all. We used them as edible spoons for our ceviche. Dinner for two with drinks & deserts -around $80, not bad at all.
Summary: 
Great place for a Happy Hour with friends, nice place to bring your date (plenty of tables for 2), enough space for small parties (6-8)
author: Ellie J.

description:
My wife and 10 month-old arrived just in time for Happy Hour which starts at 3:00 on Sunday. Despite  being the "witching hour" for quality service--in that it's the time when most restaurants are engaged in dinner prep and tend to be understaffed--we were greeted enthusiastically by the bartender and promptly seated by the waiter. Now on to the food . . .

The Happy Hour menu is largely comprised of tapas, or small dishes. Taking advantage  of this we ordered five. We also ordered a pisco  sour and beer/shot combo. The food came out right on time and was phenomenal. I repeat, "phenomenal." If you are new to Peruvian  food, it can be best described  as protein-centric. Of the five dishes, all of them begged to be ordered a second time, but the stars of the show were the civiche puerto (sp.?) and the crab wontons. All day son. These dishes were all day. 

On top of delicious food and a pleasant ambiance, the real kicker came with the check. $70. For five plates of food, two shots of tequila, two beers, and a pisco sour it cost a tank of gas. Wuuuuuuuuuut? Por que!? Like are you serious????

Eat here.
author: Lee H.

description: On of the greatest brunches I have ever had in the Bay Area. The service is very personable, from the help refilling water & clearing the table to the manager Jon always checking in making sure everything is fabulous. I had a great time here & can not wait to return for another spectacular brunch.
author: Marcus E.

description:
Stellar. 
I ordered the lomo saltado. It was incredible. If you are visiting the San Francisco area and like beef, rice and French fries. Give this a try. Mix it all together when it comes out! I didn't order dessert so cannot comment on that
author: Kim S.

description:
I think I found my favorite Fresca location. This is the only one of the four where I can tell the heater is turned on--I have no idea why the other locations keep it so chilly!!!

The service was excellent on all fronts. We came for our reservation at 6pm on a Friday night and were seated promptly and staff was so polite and wonderful. Had the tiradito and its tropical flavors knock it out of the park every single time. I just cannot get enough of the sauce and the amazing flavors on this.

Had the trout as well; I wish it had less bones and the sauce was a tad salty but I can't complain. Our waters were filled regularly so we were able to keep up with the salt content. 

I'll be back to this Fresca even if they only have one tiradito as opposed to the two tiraditos at other locations! The fact they have a bar is pretty nice too!
author: Michelle N.

description: My girlfriend and I came here last night for dinner. We love this place and absolutely love peruvian food. She had the Lomo Saltado and I had the Filet Mignon. The food was amazing as we expected it to be, and the cocktails and wine paired nicely with our meal. On top of the amazing food, drinks, and ambiance, our server Elmer was awesome. Well knowledged, and very attentive to us. He definitely made us feel welcomed and cared for. If you are looking for a great experience i recommend eating here. We'll definitely be back!
author: Seth D.

description:
If I can put a review with less than 1 star I will. Terrible service. Very slow and not clean. We waited a few minutes to be seated . After being seated it took them 10 min till anyone said anything to us. They took the order after 15 min. Our food was served after 45 min. 
At the end we were late and asked take our son's ice cream to go. When we were stand Ng by the kitchen I saw one of the staff take the ice cream scoop by his hand from a bucket and put it in the ice cream cup. Ofcourse I wouldn't have made my son eat that. On top of that the brunch food on a Saturday was 1star taste wise anyways , terrible crab scramble . My stomach hurts since then.
author: Ahmed S.

description:
I have been raving about this place to everyone since I came here for brunch. 
I can't speak for their lunch/dinner menu, but if it's anything near as good as breakfast/brunch, I'm sure it's amazing! I have tried the sweet potato pancakes, salmon eggs benedict as well as the pulled pork eggs benedict. ALL delicious! 
The pancakes are definitely my favorite so far, mainly because I love sweet breakfast foods, but the salmon benedict is a close second. At first it has a very strong and unexpected taste, but it definitely keeps you coming back for more.

The service here was great, the waiter was very attentive and had good suggestions for us during our first time here. I was surprised at how empty it was during brunch on a Sunday, though the cheap and easy Art's Cafe is next door. Still, I have been sending everyone I know over to Fresca to try the brunch. I LOVE it!
author: Jen W.

description: We love coming to Fresca on Irving.  The food is always great, the drinks just right and the people are lovely.  It can get quite loud though so conversation can be a challenge.  My boyfriend gets the Choritos (mussels) or the Trout, and I switch between Lomo Saltado and the Paella.  We always start with one of the ceviches.  The malbec was particularly good last night as were the Pisco Sours.
author: Kristina V.

description: Freska on Irving Street in San Francisco is wonderful!  Excellent food, excellent service!!
author: Kaitlyn R.

description:
Whodathunk that I would have had possibly the best burger of my life here!

We happened to be walking by during happy hour, so both got burgers and split the salmon ceviche. Definitely looking forward to taking more advantage of that happy hour and more! Aside from the fries, which were a little dry, everything was delicious, and the service was quite attentive.
author: Shendi X.

description:
My family and I dined at Fresca on a Saturday night. We had reservations and were seated promptly. Luckily, we were given a great table that was somewhat secluded. I noticed some diners (usually groups of two) were seated pretty closely to separate parties.

Our server was friendly and helpful. I originally planned to order Bistek A Lo Pobre (New York steak with a fried egg and plantain), but he made the halibut special ($28) sound so mouth-watering, I decided to try it. WOW, it was just as wonderful as he described. The halibut was buttery and melt-in-your-mouth. It came on a bed of spinach and a fried rice cake and the entire dish was surround by a creamy, spicy sauce. I LOVED it!

My fiancé ordered Paella ($29). It was a large portion and pretty tasty. The shrimp were large and cooked perfectly. His mother ended up ordering the Bistek A Lo Pobre ($28) and it was also tasty. The portion was HUGE. This is easily a two person entree. She has tried this dish in Peru and thought Fresca's version was just as good. The plantain is what adds a unique flavor to this dish. My finance's dad ordered Lomo Saltado ($22), tenderloin steak with onions, tomatoes, fries, and rice) and it was flavorful, however the meat was a little chewy.  

For drinks, fiancé and his mom tried the Pisco Sour Classico and Morado Sour. They're bitters with foamy egg white in them. These were quite sour and not for me, however my fiancé enjoyed his drink.

Overall, I loved my halibut special and I liked the dishes my family ordered. Our dishes were so satisfying and big that we didn't have room for appetizers or dessert. I definitely recommend Fresca and know I'll be coming here again.
author: Amry K.

description:
Really enjoyed our dinner here this past Sunday evening.
Being a self proclaimed afficiando of Peruvian food, I will say that everything we had was top notch.
Started off with a Pisco Sour and a Juliana Sofia- both hit the spot.
Ceviche Clasico & Causa Cangrejo for appetizers and we split the entree, Lomo Saltado.
Amount of food was just right.
I do come here fairly regular for hh drink/menu.  It was great to sit down and enjoy the many other things that Fresca has to offer.
Thank you for your quality and flavor.
author: Stacy C.

description:
Damn, I love EVERYTHING about this place.

We were coming here when it was Pasion and I was worried that the standards would be lowered when it changed names, but everything here is still fabulous.

1) The restaurant feels upscale but you can come in casual wear and feel comfortable.

2) KILLER BRUNCH!!!! NO LINE OUT THE DOOR!!! BOTTOMLESS MIMOSAS!! And...the BEST damn pancakes ever (sweet potato pancakes!!) May I also suggest the crab omelette...off the hook! Also really fabulous coffee. I think my favorite thing is that you can get breakfasty things or lunch things, so if eggs 10 million ways aren't your thing, they are sure to have some amazing peruvian meaty dish that will be.

3) Fabulous dinner menu - the ceviche is fresh and delicious. My husband got the Lomo Saltado - the flavor was unreal, as was the tomato broth with my catch of the day, mahi mahi (cooked perfectly). Satisfying, delicious, and reasonable portions.

4) Finally - the service. It is always very good. Last night we had Ivan - he was totally on point (thank you for writing our order down, it drives me nuts when waiters don't do that and then come back 5 minutes later wanting to know what it was you wanted again). He knew the difference between all the wines (they have some interesting international varieties) and he was there at all the right moments.

Overall - awesome neighborhood restaurant, perfect for any meal, especially if you're looking for a new and interesting flavor profile to whet your tastebuds!
author: Celeste R.

description: The chimichurri sauce is delish! I had the shrimp and sausage kebab. Very good! We had the empanadas for an appetizer. That was delicious too. The sauce was wonderful. Good drinks, to!
author: Amy B.

description: Started off my night grabbing some pisco sours, cristal beers and croquettes. Everything was timely, well presented and our server was courteous with a great sense of humor. For ceviche I got classico, chifa and the tiradito. To finish off the meal I got the signature lomo saltado which was cooked rare on the inside and perfectly favored for my taste. Overall it was a great experience and the ambiance matched great with the service. I didn't feel rushed and whenever I needed assistance it was there. Ill definitely be back if not here then the Noe Valley location.
author: Alex G.

description:
I loved Pasion so I was more than a little nervous that it changed.  

I am very glad to see they kept the quality of the Drinks and the Ceviche and that some of my favorite items are still on the menu.  We had a really good dinner.

I do hope they bring back the soups that I felt Pasion was so known for, and the Mango Cheesecake because it would be a shame to lose those forever.
author: Amy P.

description: Just came back from a dinner there this evening. I've driven and walked by this place many times and finally I decided to try it out. My friends and I enjoyed a wonderful dinner there. I had the pollo al a brasa and my friends had a steak dish and the salmon. We also had the stuffed red peppers (mini peppers) for appetizers. All the dishes were incredibly delicious. You know it's good when you just can't stop saying yummy, yummy, yummy. The service was excellent. The wait staff was very attentive and made sure we were satisfied with our meal and had everything we needed. We did not feel rushed and were able to linger and chat. I would definitely go back again.  I would also like to try the other Fresca restaurants in the city. Thank you Fresca!
author: Debi L.

description:
We were famished- grumpy bickering on the verge of fainting starving.  Antother restaurant we had planned on going to was packed with a long wait (the curse of the good yelps) and we ducked in here vaguely remembering that we used to enjoy Fresca back in the day.

Sat down, opened the menu and dubiously surveyed the high prices, hadn't planned on an expensive meal this time around.  Hunger battled the knowledge of bills looming on the horizon as we sat on the verge of leaving.  

Long story short, hunger won out.  The only thing that appealed was the paella to share and we ordered a couple of small appetizers for immediate consumption.  This was the right thing to order.  The appetizers were 50/50, ceviche good but pricy for what it is, other one with calamari unremarkable and would not order again.  But with the paella we struck seafoody gold!  A delicious melange and more then enough to split. 

Prior to the entree I didn't think I'd be darkening the doorway of Fresca again anytime soon, but after stuffing ourselves on the lucious paella we agreed that, despite not being thrilled with an easy $75 lunch, it was worth returning for.
author: GIR ..

description: This place is AMAZING. Order literally anything, and you will LOVE it. Guaranteed. We had a large assortment of items from the whole menu with a party of 6. Everything was very good, but the Albóndigas (lamb meatballs) and the Ceviche Chifa (with ahi tuna) were standouts.
author: Ben B.

description: Incredible. We had the Causa Cangrejo which was a taste explosion of Dungeness crab and their wicked good ailoli, ceviche sangriento which was solid, and the star of the night was the Pescado a Lo Macha. I'll be dreaming of this dish forever- the best whole fried fish I have ever had laying a seafood stew that punches you in the face. This place had everything.... And was kid friendly.
author: Ann N.

description: I came across Fresca on accident. My boyfriend and I were on vacation visiting San Francisco and we were driving around and saw a Peruvian restaurant. Being that I'm Peruvian, we decided to try it out. The inside is very pretty and it gives off a good vibe. We went around 1:30 so it was lunch time. I love Peruvian chicken so we decided to order that. The waiter told us that it's a half chicken with fries, soup and a drink for the lunch special! All for $15?! (Dine-In only) I couldn't believe it. The soup came out first. It's a chicken and veggie soup called aguadito. I loved it! The chicken came out after. It was a good size portion for two and at this point, I was so happy my boyfriend and I were sharing. The chicken had a lot of flavor and it was really tasty! The fries were crispy and our waiter was really helpful! I had a good experience here! I would definitely recommend.
author: Ruby F.

description: From the moment I walked I, I felt welcomed. I had no reservation and the host took care of me. As I sat down, we were immediately greeted and offered drinks. The bottomless mimosas are endless. We ordered the ceviche clasico, mussels and the pan con lomito. The food was delicious. Very fun atmosphere! Recommend to all
author: Gabriella R.

description: I fucking love this place. The food and the service are above all. I highly recommend you eat here. The food and drinks are delicious.
author: Cydney K.

description:
I love this place. I love it SO much. 

The Happy Hour is great, the service is always super friendly, and the host that's usually working on weeknights is super sweet and accommodating. 

My boyfriend maintains that the Old Fashioned on the HH menu is his favorite in town. As for me, I like the Pisco Sour or the Margarita. I've never eaten something here that wasn't super tasty, either! My recommendation is the Lomo Saltado with a ceviche to start. They're on OpenTable so you can usually cruise right in - it's much less busy than the one near West Portal!
author: Whitney D.

description:
Huge, huge improvement from what was once Pasion. I would definitely come back. 

Short version: get the skewer sampler and the Lomo Saltado. You will be happy.

Good stuff first: We only tried two things, but the food was absolutely fantastic. We started with the skewers sampler and I was impressed by the great charred flavor they were able achieve. The flavors were spot on and skewers tasted like they were right off the grill -  and I had to negotiate with my wife who got to eat the last piece of which one (chicken, sole, steak and mmm mmmm chorizo y shrimp). We also had the Lomo Saltado which, when it came out, I was expecting to be disappointed ( cause it looked somewhat sad). But, alas MFer, I was gladly mistaken. It was god damn delicious. Fries were crispy, steak was perfectly cooked sauce was amazing and the rice soaked up everything in the most delicious way possible. 

High five to the boss man for axing Pasion. That place was poop. This place, however....is the opposite of poop. It is delicious.

Gripes last: Did you remodel this place??? The only major complaint is that the decor (especially the awful bar) reminds me of my previous poor experiences when this place was Pasion. It's just generic and shitty in general. And 90s...and shitty. Come on your food is too good to serve it in such a crappy environment.
author: Food D.

description:
Came here for lunch with my colleagues and ordered the Aji de Gallina. It was a recommended dish from my Peruvian colleague. It was incredibly tasty with a hint of spice. It came with olives, half a hard-boiled egg, and some potato. It also comes with a side of white rice. Chicken was very flavorful and to my likely. 

Decor is really nice. There is a bar. I'm interested to come here for dinner and for some drinks. Service was great. Waiters were very helpful, quick, and efficient. 

I want to come back again soon.
author: Christina L.

description: Amazing food! Crafted with home cooking and modern fused inspirations, you build on taste. This restaurant and any other of the same family are wonderful. Highly recommended if you want a tasty and personalized experience. There are tons of restaurants in San Francisco but I always make its point to visit when I'm in town. Kudos!
author: Pamela A.

description:
I have been to this location a few times.  We are always impressed with the food quality as it is consistent from Fresca location to Fresca location, although West Portal is still our fave.

We came with friends to celebrate my birthday.  We started with the Sangria which had apples and pineapple (Yum).  We ordered the ceviche & tiradito samplers. We preferred the ceviche over the tiradito. The quantity of fish in the ceviche was more than the tiradito and since we were a party of 5, neither lasted long.

Our server was great, they must have changed out our silverware 3 times over the course of the meal.

Thanks Fresca for another great experience and meal!
author: Cindy F.

description: Just had dinner with my wife and two kids. Love this place! The food is amazing. The causa congrejo and salmon Cau Cau were fantastic. So flavorful! Very kid friendly...kid menu with crayons. Server was awesome. Really had such a great dinner here.
author: Gabe K.

description: Food was delicious, but the horrible service makes me not want to return. We sat with empty glasses for over 20 minutes. We're still waiting on our check as I write this review
author: Daniel K.

description: Been coming here for a few years with the name change and all. Definitely our go-to restaurant. Can't go wrong with any of their delicious, packed-with-flavor entrees. Love the duck w/cilantro rice (if you don't like cilantro--I don't find the flavor very strong. If anything it tastes like wonderfully garlicky green rice), trout on a hot iron plate with prawns and white rice, scallops over rice, braised pork, lomo saltado, and seafood omelette for brunch (SO GOOD). EXTRA POINTS for their recent late night happy hour menu! $6 pisco sours, $3 beers, $5 well cocktails and various appetizers at happy hour prices from 9-11 pm Fridays and Saturdays. Need to come back for $1 oysters on Mondays! Hospitality is great too :)
author: Liz L.

description: Food is good. Service was bad. It actually seemed like the hostess was working harder than the actual waiters here.
author: Elaine S.

description:
It was going to be a special date birthday dinner until 1) given lunch menu instead of dinner and 2) no one came to our table for 10 minutes... I literally was ready to dial the restaurant to ask for a waiter when one finally showed up and then... went to exchange the menu and we had to call him back to at least take a drink order before we might not see him again and 3) the chicharron de pollo appetizer was delicious until... I found not 1 but, 2 hairs on of course, my last bite... Ugh! 

The paella and lomo saltado were very good but, the best thing about the meal was the sangria and  that they didn't charge us for the dish with hair. We left and found dessert and service with a smile elsewhere. The thing is, the food is yummy but, the few times we've been here the service is always bad with a capital B. That's why they get 1 star instead of 4 or 5. I waited tables all through college and I usually tip 20%+... But last night I had to force myself to leave more than 10%. They made date birthday dinner a not so pleasant time. Not sure if they will get another try.
author: Carol P.

description: One of the best sandwiches I've ever had. I went to Fresca with my friends last year. I didn't remember the names of our order, but I am sure there has avocado in that sandwich. We ordered another plate with rotisserie chicken with fries. The food here was awesome!! I hope I'll be back soon.
author: Chloé C.

description: this place is very different from the one on fillmore. They're food is different and the service was definitely different. We didn't have to wait but the waiter stuck us in a small table in a corner when there are bigger tables in the area closer to the window. I wanted to try this place because they have causa. We ordered our food but was disappointed when I saw a tiny little plate of cause for $16 :( I got my usual peruvian dish which was lomo soltado and my husband got the pork chicken. They were both ok but too pricey for the portion. Not sure if I will come back to this place.
author: Kathy P.

description: Wanted to love this. It was very good but not quite five stars. The service was a little pokey, and it wasn't an especially busy night. Food was really authentic, but not the best Peruvian in town.
author: Jason P.

description: Love this place. Every thing we ordered was delicious. A special recommendation for raw fish lovers is the tuna ceviche. The staff is really friendly and their pisco sour is top!
author: Celia C.

description: Their salmon ceviche. Get the eff out!!! Happy hour prices are on pointe too. Chill atmosphere in my neighborhood. Nice service. One less star because it is a bit pricy for what it is. But I still come back.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Delicious food, great service !

Went there last night with a friend and the food was so good. I've been there before as well as to the one on 24th street. I think last night was the best food I've had there.

We had the mussels with Chorizo, the ceviche/ tiradito special with Mahi Mahi in a tamarind sauce and the sweet potato fries....Yum! 
Told our super waiter Danny that the ceviche special needs to be a new addition to the menu, not just a special it was that good !

The host was very friendly and accommodating. That's always a plus in my book.
author: Anita B.

description: Had a pretty bad experience today.  Food wasn't cooked, wasn't served as ordered, wasn't fixed when requested and general bad service. It's a bummer because I've enjoyed the place in the past. I feel like I just wasted $60.
author: matt e.

description:
This was the worst brunch experience I've ever had. There was no part of this experience that was commendable in any way except that the bathroom was remarkably clean and spacious and that our server was not awful. We had brunch as a group of four. I ordered eggs benedict with pulled pork and rosemary bacon, along with one of their cocktails, while the other three people in my party ordered bottomless mimosas. 

There was zero rosemary flavor to the bacon and it was limp and undercooked. An inability to provide good bacon at a brunch place is a huge red flag-- alas, this was not the end.The eggs benedict came with two hard-boiled-- not poached-- eggs. Everyone at my table had some sort of dish that advertised poached eggs-- we all received eggs hard-boiled as rocks. I'm unclear on why this restaurant seems unable to poach an egg correctly- there are literal buzzfeed videos that break it down simply. The fries that came with my benedict were limp and soggy, and I asked for aioli but got this super watery, cilantro sauce instead. The hollandaise sauce atop my eggs was weirdly lemony (but in a dishsoap kind of way, not a tasty citrus kind of way)-- and finally, the pork had zero seasoning. zero. I don't understand how you can call yourself a peruvian place when you're clearly completely averse to spices. 

To add insult to injury, the place ran out of their "bottomless" mimosas barely forty minutes into our meal. My friends asked multiple servers for refills, was told they were coming, and finally our server showed up with the check and shrugged. there was no offer to comp the mimosas or provide another beverage in its place. To my mind, this is the literal least that could have been done-- if you charge people for a 2-hour bottomless drink, and can barely serve them for half that time, you comp the drinks or provide something else in its place. The waiter showed up with a refill when we were getting up to leave, which-- thanks dude, really helpful.

An absolute disgrace of a restaurant. We paid nearly $40 a person for crappy eggs, underseasoned food, and inadequate mimosas Save your money, go get a bagel across the street and then go get a bottomless brunch actually worth the money in the Mission.
author: Meg K.

description: Amazing!  The chef will make you anything to order.  I have lots of food allergies, and he made me trout with shrimp and garlic/butter...Was so delish.  Cooked perfectly and so tender and flavorful.  I had the beef hearts for an appetizer aka corazon, and it was the best beef heart I have ever had.  Tasted so fresh and did not have a liver like flavor, which I am used too.  Tasked like quality steak!
author: Liz M.

description: Came here for brunch and bottomless mimosas on a Sunday 6/28 around 1030am. I was really happy that there wasn't a wait since my fave brunch spot (kitchen story) could easily be a 2hr wait. Got seated in a booth table which I really started getting comfortable in while sipping on my mimosa when the host asks us "would you mind moving to that table" (he explained that a party of 23 was coming and that he had messed up the seating arrangement.) I didn't really want to move since I was comfortable but we did anyways to help the host out. So we went along with our brunch, waiter was sweet, and the food was ok etc. So at maybe 1045am I notice the table that I was in get seated with 4 people which I'm like ?????? because you asked us to move to seat 4 people which is really stupid cause that's how many people we had as well....... My friends complain amongst each other as to why we had to move when that table got filled by the same amount of people and no significant change had been made.  BUT then, the host has the nerve to really come up to my table and tell me that I need to leave right now because the party of 23 is here. I thought this was the reason why we moved in the first place to resolve the party of 23 issue. He told my table and another table next to mine but didn't tell the booth table (my original table.) So I have no idea why they got to stay at their table for however long they wanted to when my party arrived first......So I basically got kicked out because I was in the way of the party of 23 but my original table didn't get kicked out. So if I was still in that table I would of been able to enjoy a lot longer because they were not in your way of the party of 23.......Terrible.
author: Mauricia L.

description:
I remember when getting a table at Fresca (both West Portal and Fillmore locations) was an ordeal.  The place was packed, but the food was tasty.  

Today, I decided to go to the 9th Avenue location for the first time.  My cousin and I were seated promptly, and that was the highlight of the meal.  

Drinks---

After both ordering the lomo saltado lunch special, our fountain beverages arrived.  When my cousin first tasted her soda, she said, "There is something wrong with this.  There are no bubbles. It tastes weird."  I tasted my soda, and I agreed with my cousin.  She ordered a replacement soda, but this time she switched from cola to lemon lime.  She didn't even get a full sip before she said, "this one is worse." We discussed the problem with the waiter, and he 
said there was a "problem with the lines all week." He offered to bring her a replacement drink, and she chose lemonade.  The lemonade was good, and I, too, decided to switch drinks.  

Salad

Our lunch specials came with a choice of soup or salad.  We both chose salad, which was supposed to be a mixed green salad dressed with a creamy cilantro dressing.  The salad looked and tasted like it was dressed with olive oil.  I couldn't taste any cilantro, and it did not appear to be a creamy dressing.  I do not like my salad swimming in dressing, but I really couldn't taste any cilantro.

Main course - Lomo Saltado

After the disappointing drinks and salads, we both hoped that our main course would be better, but our experience managed to get worse.  Upon the arrival of our plates, my cousin tasted her french fries and said, "wow, they didn't salt these at all."  I tasted mine and said, "I must have gotten your salt and mine." My fries were pretty salty, but after a disappointing salad, I was hungry.  I got about four bites into my meal, when I discovered a large black hair in my lomo saltado.  My cousin saw me pulling our the hair and said, "Are you serious?" I said, "yes.  A hair.  This is a horrible meal."  

I told the waiter about the hair, and they offered to make me a new entree.  As hungry as I was, I declined the offered.  My cousin couldn't and didn't really enjoy her meal because she was concerned she too might find a stray hair.  

The Check

When I received the check, I noticed that the waiter did not charge me for my meal, which I appreciated as I only had a few bites before I noticed the hair.  The bill came out to a little more than $16, and I gave a $20 bill.  When the check returned to me, my change was only $3.  Thats right.  They didn't even give me the proper change.  I was so angry that I didn't even say anything; we just wanted to get out of there as soon as possible. I'm surprised I bothered to leave a tip.  

Our waiter was very polite about the issues with the drinks and the main course, but I feel insult was added to injury when I didn't get the proper change. I felt cheated.  This last experience left me with a horrible memory of Fresca.  I am sad because I used to love it, but I guess I need to find a new Peruvian restaurant.
author: Gabrielle W.

description: I really enjoyed my evening !! It's was fun evening its mesmerizing time of life got good friends accompanied.....over all dining experience was top notch !!  I just little disappointed with my entree !! Appetizer  was awesome ... May I had more expect ion after I eat appetizer 's ..... :)
author: raja g.

description: Come on Fresca you can do better. The Tequenos and empanadas were just fried doughy stuff, the lomo saltado (which I have loved in the past) had soggy fries and underwhelming meat quality. I hope Fresca improves, I like the sangria.
author: Jason P.

description: Went in for lunch and we both had the Lomo Saltado, which was small cuts of beef seasoned with cilantro red onions, tomatoes and spices. It came with rice & fries...really rice and fries? I didn't eat the rice, the fries were of the shoestring variety properly cooked, crispy on the outside tender inside. However, the fries should not be the highlight of the dish. The beef although well seasoned was chewy and was a bit on the salty side. Service was excellent and we were served in reasonable time. I never complain about price but a few cuts of less than quality beef and the rest being 2 starches I think it was way over-priced. This is not a place I'd go back to. It appears to be a local chain and I'm not sure about the great reviews.
author: Bill F.

description: Came here with a friend . The old fashioned here was so good ! One of the best I have had . The ceviche was an explosion of sorts in my mouth ! Such a pleasant find.
author: Shilpa P.

description:
Pasion was a good restaurant but Fresca has many similar items on the menu and I would say is a bit better priced...
Personally I love the whole branzino - I had it at the West Portal location but here, in the Sunset, the sauce is more flavorful - well, spicier too so if you don't like spice you won't probably agree! It comes with seafood and it is practically a lot of food so worth the price and good quality. I found the service great as well - very accommodating and nice.
So, thank you, neighbor!
author: VIORICA C.

description: I hadn't tried Peruvian food before and it was OK. My dish was rather salty, though. The people working there were so welcoming and friendly.
author: Neggy M.

description:
Great food, great service and great atmosphere.

My boyfriend and I have been wanting to try this place, and it sure didn't disappoint.  We sat next to the wackiest couple - the man was super drunk, causing a scene, unhappy with the service (for zero reason) and ended up falling asleep at the table.  I was very impressed with the staff's ability to handle such a rude customer.
author: Michele E.

description:
Everything is terrific about this Peruvian restaurant. It evens has a parking lot in the back off of 8th Ave. The service was fantastic as we were warmly greeted by the maître'd Sebastian. He was very helpful and accommodating giving our family great recommendations. 
The servers were excellent. The food was fantastic. We started off with the ceviche sampler which is a combination of 4 different types of ceviche, very fresh tasting and flavorful.
I ordered the paella, which was great. Served in an iron skillet, saffron flavored rice with prawns, sausage, chicken, mussels and octopus. Excellent.
The wife had the pork, my son had the shrimp chowder and my daughter had the lamb shank. All the dishes were full of flavor and well done. I even had a couple of glasses of a Peruvian lager which was pretty good also. They have a small full sized bar near the entrance and serve several Peruvian beers on tap.
A very enjoyable dining experience.
author: jack d.

description: Delicious with great service! I'd recommend the cangrejo causa. Nice ambiance, glad to have this open up in the neighborhood.
author: L. Y.

description: This place is amazing! The food is always good and the service is always on point. I recommend the pisco sours, the rotisserie chicken, the ceviches and for dessert, the flan.
author: Arturo D.

description: One of the best Peruvian places in the city. I absolutely loved the shrimp and chorizo skewer as well as the lomo saltado. This is a classic Peruvian dish and they made it perfectly - the saltiness and texture were on point and the fries and gravy perfectly complemented the medium rare meat. The rice balances out the many flavors. Pair this with a deep Malbec and you will have a symphony in your mouth - your tastebuds will forever love you
author: Amrit S.

description:
Just had a great roast pork dinner at Fresca.  They were booked up and we had to sit at the bar and were well cared for there.  Can't believe how hard that bartender works
.  Dinner and service were great!!!
author: Dennis M.

description: Honey and I decided to come here for dinner since it was close to home. We reserved a table via OpenTable and got seated right away. The place was a little dim, kind of romantic. Service was very good. We had ceviche, quinoa, and one more dish. Food tasted good. It is a $$$ kind of meal, not $$.
author: Allan W.

description:
Came here for dinner on Friday night. It was busy and there were 2 large parties that were very loud. We asked for a quiet spot and they happily seated us at the chef's bar.
We ordered the Causa Cangrejo, the Ceviche Sifa, the quinoa locro and maduros (maduros are not an item in the menu but you can order them as a side).
Everything was delicious and it was great to watch the chef preparing our food.
For dessert we had the alfajores. We were not impressed. We have had better.
Overall a great experience.
author: Judith V.

description:
First, let me clarify, this is a review for the weekend brunch and the 1 star is a review of the overall unpleasant experience. If I were rating the food, to be fair, the flavors were fairly complex and would rate somewhat higher than 1 star.

I had a poor experience for dinner at their restaurant on West Portal years ago and the experience was so bad that I never ate at any of their locations again. Today, my family and I were looking to try a different brunch place in the neighborhood and since they opened fairly recently and have pretty decent yelp reviews, we thought we'd give it a try.

The restaurant is clean and we got there shortly after it opened at 10am and it was pretty empty, only 1 other table had diners. We ordered the crab omelette, the pork benedict, and  a side of bacon. 

Our waiter seemed quite friendly at first, chatting us up about the cold foggy weather. But the problems hit quickly after we ordered. Considering how there were very few customers there and I saw a full kitchen staff on the way in, the food was quite slow in coming, at least a 15 minute wait. 

However, the bigger issue was that when it did come, they got my husband's order wrong and did not bring our child's side of bacon. The busboy who was much more competent told us later that unfortunately, the server got the order wrong and completely forgot to even order the side of bacon. At least he was nice enough to apologize, no such behavior from the very incompetent "server" who tried to pretend like nothing happened. Pretty pathetic considering that our table was the only one he was actively serving!

The flavors of the crab omelette were tasty but only the egg part of it was somewhat warm. The crab and avocado inside were deathly cold which within minutes made the whole thing equally cold. A chilly omelette is pretty gross! The side of potatoes that came with it were pretty good but the portion size was completely skimpy. A $16 dish came with way fewer than 10 potatoes and just the omelette. No other sides like fruit or toast.

I decided to give the "waiter" a second chance and provided my constructive feedback to him in a nice tone re: the cold filling in the omelette and the fact that he forgot part of our order and got basically 2/3 of our order wrong. I thought perhaps he would try to do something to make up for his errors and try to have the customers leaving the restaurant more satisfied. 

But nope, all he said was that he'd tell the people in the back and tried to explain to me that the crab needed to be cold. I then proceeded to explain to him that I've had other crab omelettes in other establishments that had much warmer crab filling. Once again, no apology and no attempt to give us a break on the check or any other gesture to let us know they care about our business.

So FRESCA, as a native San Franciscan, I'm done with you. Fool me once, shame on you. Fool me twice, shame on me. There will absolutely NOT be a 3rd time at any of your restaurants for any type of meal and you can trust that I will be telling everyone I know not to eat at your very over-priced and generally lacking restaurant!
author: Judy M.

description:
I'm kind of pissed off that Pasion disappeared and now Fresca has arrived. I enjoyed Pasion. It was good food, kind of a date night kind of place, but I always had a delicious and satisfying meal, and always had a good server.

My husband and I came in to try Fresca out, and left really pissed off. Our waiter was really aloof and kept rushing us. HIs whole demeanor was rude. We asked about the difference between ceviche and tiradito, and the staff member who explained it didn't do a very good job of telling us exactly what it was, because he basically said that it was just like ceviche just in a "different shape." It sounded good, so I ordered the sampler. When it arrived it came in a really gaudy display that took up the whole table, and was basically just a 4 different pieces of sashimi in a different sauce, not really like ceviche at all. 

For my main, I ordered what was described as a sweet potato stew, but when it came out it was in a GIANT CERAMIC TUB, and was almost overflowing. It was basically a ton of bland mushed sweet potatoes with some cubes of white cheese and green beans. I wanted to cry. My husband ordered the same thing and we just looked at what we ordered and knew this was such a bad idea coming here.

The whole tab came out to over $75. I couldn't wait to get the f out of there. Such a huge rip- off for lackluster service and bland over-priced food. I miss Pasion and wish this restaurant chose some other neighborhood where B.S. restaurants like this is more the standard. :(
author: Catface G.

description: Great Lomo Saltado and various cerviche. Denny is the best waiter with great drink recommendations. Come late for great seating midweek.
author: Ken L.

description: Perhaps I didn't order their best dishes, but I believe consistency and accuracy is key to a thriving restaurant and business.  The lamb meat balls were dry, overcooked and nearly inedible.  I didn't bother to finish them.  The tuna ceviche was a tartar, which I liked, but would prefer to know what I am ordering.  The service was slow and scrambled, and the drinks were colorful but not as tasty as they looked.  I don't think I will return unless someone strong arms me.
author: Sarah S N.

description: Had dinner here for the first time last week and it couldn't have been better! The food was amazing! We ordered the ceviche sampler, empanadas, calamari, pollo de chicharron, and for dessert the tres leche cake and lava cake- all amazing! The service and atmosphere was great too! I've already told so many people to try it out, and i definitely will be returning as well! Love it here!
author: Bianca V.

description: Where has the Pasion gone? I seem to recognize some former peeps behind the bar, and now with more passion. This is for a Happy Hour bite--Cervice and burger. Both very well prepared, bar staff seemed more energized. Will retry with group, last gathering at Pasion fared poorly due to indifferent service.
author: YearOf M.

description: While the food was OK, the service was non-existent. We were seated and ordered. They brought our $4 sodas, and eventaually the food. That was sum total of service, unless you count their delivering the bill. When I wanted condiments I had to go in search of them.They never followed up to see if we wanted anything. In addition to billing for the their health insurance - which in itself is a tip -  they asked for 18 - 22%. FOR WHAT?
author: Maisie B.

description: Fresca on Irving is an elegant restaurant disguised as south American specialty.  The dishes are rich and well balanced in terms of flavor and texture. I had the salmon, which was delicious and well prepared, it was topped with a garlic spinach salad which blew my mind. The cocktails are all top notch and the wine selection should suffice for most vinophiles.  Great experience, great food...
author: Mike S.

description:
Fantastic food! Horrendous service.

Every dish was great, the cevhices, fish, and steak were phenominal. Unfortunately service was the worst we've experienced in San Francisco. Drinks took 20 minutes and the waiter completely forgot a dish. We only ordered two entrees. The waiter wrote them down and both were his recommendations. The first dish came out relatively quickly and assuming it was family style we began. The dish was great. 30 minutes went by and the waiter returned informing us the kitchen was closing. I asked if my fish was almost ready at which point the waiter said "oh no I forgot let me get that right away" as if it wasn't obvious I was sitting for 40 minutes looking at my dates dish. The dish finally came and was great which made it semi ok I was still charged for it. Hopefully they figure service out. 

Food was great. Service was extremely frustrating.
author: Marty H.

description: Came here and sat at the bar for a quick lunch on Saturday. Restaurant was fairly busy overall. Service was incredibly slow and inattentive, nobody brought me a fork or napkin when the food came so I sat there staring at it for a while until I could flag down someone. Asked for a fork and the guy seemed to not hear me (he gave no response), so I repeated myself. He made eye contact and made a comment about hearing me the first time. OK whatever dude, an acknowledgment is the usual behavior when you hear a request. When I finished eating my waiter seemed to be doing everything except checking on me. Sat there for 15 minutes with my dirty plates and empty drink glasses, wanting to leave but unable to. Ended up leaving cash on the table and walking out. Food was just OK. Interesting concept but but the burger I ordered tasted fairly generic. Have been here a few times for lunch/brunch, have never been impressed. Based on my experience today, this was my last visit. There are better options in the neighborhood.
author: Max A.

description: Amazingly crafted Peruvian food that is fresh, well proportioned and SO delicious!  I've had hit or miss days as far as customer service goes.  The first time I went for bottomless mimosas and the hostess and all the servers were extremely charming and made sure we had a great time.  I was so excited I went back to show the place off to my boyfriend on Memorial Day and the place was seriously understaffed for the volume of people.  We felt pretty neglected as servers kept passing by our table without even offering us water.  I was pretty astonished but understand there are off days.  I'll still be back to check it out - there food alone is enough to satisfy me.
author: Natalia L.

description: Made a reservation on open table,  when I called to say I was 5 min late, I was told "glad you called".  Walked in and was told "we closed,  all the cooks went home,  kitchen closed".  Won't be trying this or any of the other locations..... what's the point of a reservationof its not honored??
author: Lori Y.

description: Re-opened as Fresca the day after Christmas. Also with a slightly pared down menu compared to the other Fresca restaurants. I spoke with their corporate chef and he said they are trying to just focus on the popular/favorite items. Also he said they were pretty much forced to have a Pasion-esque happy hour as customers kept coming in and asking about it. Happy hour starts at 4:30. The anticucho corazon (beef heart) is one of my favorite dishes of all time. As far as the renovation goes they pretty much just repainted and added some bar seating that looks into the kitchen.
author: Tobias P.

description: I am so bummed. I used to really like this place. Some of their dishes are very good. I typically order ceviche and yucca fries and it's often for pick up or delivery. The couple times I have eaten there, the service has been fine. The last time I ordered the ceviche classico it arrived and was nothing like the other times I had ordered it. The fish was gray and tasted extremely fishy. There were pieces in it that looked inedible and one that tasted so disgusting I had to immediately stop eating it. I figured this ceviche was a fluke because I hadn't had trouble with it before. I just received the same order for dinner tonight and it is equally as gross. Their ceviche didn't used to be like this- it always tasted fresh. I don't know what happened, but it has really gone downhill and I am so disappointed with the food I received. I can't believe they actually put this in a box to serve to a customer.
author: Nicki T.

description:
A friend and I met here for lunch about a week ago. We had a very nice meal with good service.  The waitstaff was knowledgable on the menu and the dishes' ingredients.  We each had a cocktail - I had the Maracuja Sour and my friend, a Margarita.  My drink was excellent and really had the flavor of passion fruit.  My friend said his was good too.
I had a seafood dish and my friend, chicken.  My dish was very good.  No overcooked fish.  My friend loved his chicken.
Service was good, except that the food runner was a bit confused on what extra items needed to be delivered with dishes.  He forgot to bring a vessel for the mussel and clam shells.  Our waiter said he was new and still figuring stuff out.  The oversight was quickly remedied.  
All in all, this was a very good experience. I will go back.  I love that there is something a bit different in the inner sunset and hope this place succeeds.
author: Elizabeth L.

description:
I enjoy the other Fresca locations as well as Pasion and wanted to try this location for dinner.

Hopefully it's just a curve.  

I asked for a half pitcher of sangria (just me and my wife) and the waiter said they can't do that.  I told him I was able to do that previously at Pasion, but he just said no - didn't even ask the manager, so instead of a sale for a half pitcher, we just got water.  I can understand if I said "I want half a steak".  I didn't want multiple glasses of sangria as then we'd have to flag someone down and wait for a new glass.  That's why we like having the pitcher there to refill ourselves.

Ordered the beef heart skewers that came out on a wood cutting board - the juices dripped onto the table as it was placed down.  This should be served on a plate or a cutting board with an indentation to hold the juices.  Dipping sauce was a little too much like mayo.  The beef heart was good aside from the dipping sauce.

Paella was good, wasn't given a small bowl for the shells like usual.

I ordered the braised pork shoulder.  This wasn't moist enough and was served with white rice and beans.  Since it wasn't that moist, they should have had more of the braising liquid so that the rice would have some flavor too.  So the entire dish was kinda dry.

Service was spotty as well.  From looking at the mirror and how they were working, they had to ask each other what table each dish needed to go to.
author: Peter C.

description: Accommodating, professional and nice nice nice staff at this restaurant.  From our server Ivan to his sister greeting guests (she was on loan for the day from the Noe branch) to Ivan's assistant, they just couldn't have been better. We went during brunch hours but were able to order off the regular menu. The Huz had empanadas that were flaky and wonderful and not a bit greasy and paella that was generously portioned. I had trucha (pan fried trout with carmelized shrimp) that was so delicious! We will definitely go back soon. Note to the three 30-somethings (2 females, 1 male) who sat in the table next to us. Your foul-mouths were definitely not appreciated. Too bad such delicious food was wasted in your nasty gullets. Show a little class next time.
author: Cydney B.

description: The food and drinks were all great!  We had a seafood paella, the ceviche sampler, empanadas, and picarones for dessert.  Everything was great.  I remember eating picarones as a kid in Peru.  They were just like I remember!
author: Monica Y.

description: The food is excellent and other experiences here were terrific. But this time, the service was slow, inaccurate and confused.
author: Jeb S.

description: Tasty food, chill atmosphere, and great service. I'd say it's more of a trendy type of place with Peruvian influences. Still pretty good to try for a quick bite.
author: Shaleena K.

description: This place deserves a very solid 4 stars. The food is excellent, the quality of the ingredients is good, the items are flavorful yet well balanced. We had the ceviche sampler and it was nice. My only knock against it is that the portions should have been a bit more (especially considering the price of the sampler). Even sharing between two persons as an appetizer, it was not quite enough. The entrees were very good. I really liked the Lomo Saltado here, I loved that the beef was tender and not overcooked.
author: Winston W.

description: I love this restaurant. The ambience was nice and it wasn't too crowded at the time my wife and I took my mother out for her birthday dinner.  The ceviche was some of the best I've ever had and the Pisco sours were wonderful.  I had the adobo de chancho, and the pork shoulder was perfectly cooked and the beans in sauce that came with it along with the rice or just absolutely tasty.I would definitely come back here again and recommend other people to try it.  My wife had the Lomo Saltado, and having done a field school in Peru she said that the Lomo was about as close as you're ever going to get to good true Peruvian food that she had while in country.
author: Steve N.

description: Picarones weren't as awesome as in Peru , tequeños were decent , inca cola saved the day.
author: Micaela L.

description: I came here twice and I really enjoyed their food. I liked the rotisserie chicken entree, which came with fries and a salad. I only took 1 star off because the server couldn't understand English. He had to call someone else for help to serve us. But overall the food was great, service was great, and I will definitely be back again.
author: Annie L.

description:
Love the chicken skewer plate!  And the fried plaintains and yuca potatoes.  The vibe is a mix of younger people and families, depending on when you come.

Pretty cool spot.
author: Kirsten M.

description: Crazy good brunch! Quality food, interesting menu that's not your standard brunch menu. Good portion size. Great service. Can't wait to try dinner here.
author: Phil D.

description: Excellent food made with fresh ingredients, presented well.  Friendly service,  Only criticism is sometimes things were a little too salty.
author: M D.

author: Alonso I.

description: Great food and drinks!  Love seeing Chef Michael Reese on Wednesday's working the floor.  Staff are very friendly and the bartenders make great drinks and are very attentive.
author: Johnny C.

description: Love this place! Amazing food, good service and a relatively stylish and hip environment without breaking the bank! The lomo Saltado is THE BOMB!!!
author: Desmond G.

description: Decided to stop by for brunch/lunch on Saturday since Art's Cafe had a wait and Fresca's didn't. Don't know why it didn't because the food was great! We got the Steak Salad and Pan Con Lomito. The Pan Con Lomito was on a delicious Dutch crunch bread and served with a side of fries. Both  bread and fries had the perfect crunch to it. The customer service was particularly accommodating as well. Would definitely come back again and try their actual breakfast menu. The restaurant eventually got more full around 1pm.
author: Angela P.

description: If you want excellent service and excellent food, this is the place.  Had a party of six tonight and the food was top notch from the appetizers to the main course to the desert.  Made for a great night.
author: Joe C.

description: This was my first time trying Peruvian food and they did not disappoint.  Their $$ price does match their quality and preparation of food.  The food I ordered was fresh and delightful.  It was not heavy at all; I left filled and content that there is a restaurant exsisting that can cook healthy food with flavor.  I would come back again and if you were in the city wanting to try something new.  Check out this Peruvian restaurant, I'm sure you'll have a great experience.
author: LovesToEat S.

description: I'd been to the other Fresca locations before and enjoyed the food so wanted to try out the new Fresca in my hood. Sadly, I was quite disappointed. The food is overpriced and does not taste fresh. We got the crab cousa, which is the size of a crap cake for $13(an appetizer for one essentially), which I thought would be good as crab is in season, but this was defn not fresh crab. I got the seafood paella and my partner the lamb, which is essentially the same dish just with different meat. The rice was SO SO salty it gave me a headache and I can't even think about eating my leftovers, my mouth is still recovering from the sodium onslaught. The dining room is loud(which is not surprising as it has been for the last two restaurants that have been in this location) and I found myself struggling to hear my partner, even though the restaurant was not full. The staff was friendly and prompt. I don't know why this locations food is lacking compared to the others, but I won't be returning.
author: Sophia C.

description: Enjoyed the dinner with my friends here. We ordered ceviche, beef heart skewer, and lamb shank. Everything is so delicious, but the line gets long during dinner time. Would love to come back.
author: Eleanor C.
